0.title: Most bogus case against me: Karti Chidambaram on 'visa for Chinese' case
0.article_body: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram, accused of facilitating visas for Chinese nationals by flouting rules, said that every case that has been filed against him is a "bogus case". "One is bogus... another is more bogus. This one [the 'visa for Chinese' case] is most bogus," he added. The Congress leader is also accused in INX media case.

1.title: Announce polls in 6 days or I'll return to Islamabad for protest: Imran Khan to Pak govt
1.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan gave six-day ultimatum to the country's government to dissolve assemblies and announce elections. He called the government "imported" and said that he will return to Islamabad for protest after six days. Khan started his march from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa with a large caravan to demand the removal of the government and an immediate national election.

2.title: Andreessen Horowitz raises record $4.5 billion crypto fund
2.article_body: Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz has raised $4.5 billion for its fourth cryptocurrency fund, the industry's largest to date. Around $1.5 billion from the fund will be used to invest in seed rounds of startups and $3 billion for venture investments. The firm unveiled a $2.2 billion fund to invest in crypto networks in June last year.

3.title: Monkeypox not as contagious as COVID, but matter of concern: NTAGI
3.article_body: Monkeypox is not as contagious or severe as COVID-19, but its spread is a matter of concern, said National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora. He added that the disease will have more severe outcomes in those who are immunocompromised. He further said that the government has set up an expert committee on monkeypox.

4.title: Pune Police mention cyber fraudsters' 'procedures', share tip for safety
4.article_body: Pune Police took to Twitter to share "new criminal procedures" of cyber fraudsters, saying that fraudsters put mobile number on photos of Google Maps listing of popular stores and claim to provide very fast home delivery. The tweet added that fraudsters share QR code for payment. Sharing a tip, the police asked the public to check the number on Truecaller.

5.title: Police should treat sex workers with dignity, not abuse them: SC
5.article_body: Sex workers and their children enjoy all basic human rights and other rights guaranteed in the Constitution to all citizens, the Supreme Court observed. "Police (in all states and UTs) should treat all sex workers with dignity and should not abuse them, both verbally and physically, subject them to violence or coerce them into any sexual activity," the bench stated.

6.title: US, Japan stage joint fighter jet flight after N Korea missile launches
6.article_body: The US and Japan said they flew fighter jets together over the Sea of Japan after North Korea fired missiles into the waters that separate Japan and Korean peninsula on Wednesday. The exercise was meant to "showcase combined capabilities to deter...regional threats", US said. North Korea fired missiles hours after US President Joe Biden left the region following a trip.

7.title: Nadal becomes 3rd man in tennis history to win 300 Grand Slam singles matches
7.article_body: World number five Rafael Nadal defeated Corentin Moutet in the second round of the ongoing French Open to become the third man in tennis history to record 300 Grand Slam match wins. Nadal is behind Roger Federer's 369 wins and Novak Djokovic's 324. Nadal will now take on Dutchman Botic van de Zandschulp in the third round on Friday.

8.title: In a first, 12-year-old boy celebrates birthday in Noida Metro coach
8.article_body: A 12-year-old Noida-based boy, Swayam Saksham, became the first person to hold a birthday party on an Aqua Line coach. The celebration was attended by 15 of Swayam's friends, along with 10 relatives. With its 'Celebrations on Wheels' initiative, Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) in 2020 announced a facility for people to book individual metro coaches for private celebrations.

9.title: Delhi to give incentive of up to ₹5,500 to 10,000 buyers of e-cycles
9.article_body: Delhi government announced the first 10,000 e-cycle buyers will get a purchase incentive of 25% with a cap of a maximum of ₹5,500 per unit. An additional incentive of ₹2,000 will be given to the first 1,000 buyers, it added. Cargo e-cycles will be eligible for an incentive of 33% of the selling price up to ₹1,500, Delhi government stated.

10.title: Punjab woman given triple talaq over dowry; husband, 3 others booked
10.article_body: Police have booked the husband of a woman from Ludhiana along with his parents and matchmaker for allegedly giving triple talaq to his wife last year. "The groom's family demanded...car from us as dowry," the woman's father claimed. "When we were unable to arrange the car, [the matchmaker] handed my daughter a...paper with...'talaq' written on it thrice," he alleged.

11.title: 3 LeT terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Kupwara
11.article_body: Three terrorists affiliated with the terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) were shot dead in an encounter that broke out in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara on Thursday morning, Kashmir Zone Police said. Police launched the operation based on a specific input and foiled the infiltration attempt by terrorists. Incriminating materials, including arms and ammunition, were also recovered, police said.

12.title: Will get big opportunity: Yediyurappa after son denied MLC ticket
12.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has said he is confident that BJP will give his son BY Vijayendra a big opportunity in the future. The statement comes a day after Vijayendra was not named in candidate list for MLC polls. "The party will not forsake those who are capable and loyal," said Yediyurappa. The party will create opportunities, he added.

13.title: Boeing's Starliner capsule returns from ISS in key test mission
13.article_body: Boeing's Starliner capsule successfully returned to Earth from the International Space Station and landed in New Mexico on Wednesday, completing a key test flight. The test was to show if the spacecraft is capable of carrying humans to the International Space Station. The firm's previous two attempts to carry out the mission had ended in failure.

14.title: ED raids 7 locations in Mumbai & Pune linked to Maharashtra minister Anil Parab
14.article_body: Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at locations linked to Maharashtra Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Anil Parab in connection with alleged irregularities in land deal in coastal Dapoli area of Ratnagiri and other charges. Raids were conducted at seven locations in Pune and Mumbai after fresh case under criminal sections of Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) was filed.

15.title: Infinity Learn announces the acquisition of Wizklub for $10 million
15.article_body: Sri Chaitanya-backed Edtech startup Infinity Learn announced that it has acquired Wizklub, a startup that builds skills for children aged 6-14 with High Order Thinking Skills (HOTS) & SmarTech programs, for $10 million. Named 'Infinity Futurz', this vertical aims to help children develop active learning, critical thinking, innovation, & the ability to use technology to solve real-world problems.

16.title: Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta walks Cannes red carpet, shares pics
16.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife, banker Amruta Fadnavis walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival. Sharing pictures on Instagram, she wrote, "Walked the [red carpet]...to raise awareness about food, health and sustainability." Amruta was accompanied by First Lady of Ivory Coast Dominique Ouattara, Lebanese-Jordanian Princess Ghida Talal and actor Stone among others.

17.title: India reports 2,628 new COVID-19 cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
17.article_body: India has reported 2,628 COVID-19 cases, 2,167 recoveries and 18 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,124 COVID-19 cases and 17 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 15,414, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,525.

18.title: What did court tell Yasin Malik when he claimed to be Mahatma Gandhi's follower?
18.article_body: Yasin Malik told NIA court he gave up violence in 1994 and declared he would follow Mahatma Gandhi's peaceful path. The court said Malik cannot claim to be Gandhi's follower. The court added that Gandhi called off entire non-cooperation movement after Chauri Chaura violence but Malik neither condemned violence nor withdrew his calendar of protest which led to the violence.

19.title: Messages sent by 18-year-old minutes before killing 19 kids at US school revealed
19.article_body: The 18-year-old Texas gunman who killed 19 children and two teachers sent messages on Facebook minutes before he attacked, Texas Governor Greg Abbott said on Wednesday. The gunman first sent a message saying, "I'm going to shoot my grandmother." "I've shot my grandmother," he wrote in the second message. He then messaged, "I'm going to shoot an elementary school."

20.title: AIADMK 'weak opposition', people expect me to lead: Sasikala
20.article_body: VK Sasikala, aide of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa, on Wednesday described the AIADMK under present leadership as a "weak opposition". "It's been a year since they came to power and they have been fighting with the union government. They need to implement and execute projects," she stated. Sasikala added that people are expecting her to lead the party.

21.title: Verdict delivered, not justice: Gupkar alliance on life sentence to Yasin Malik
21.article_body: People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD) said that the life sentence to J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik in a terror funding case is "unfortunate". PAGD added that the NIA court has "delivered verdict but not justice". "We are afraid that this will further compound the uncertainties in the region and will only fuel more alienation and separatist feelings," PAGD stated.

22.title: Can expect new film starring Dhanush's character in lead soon: Russo Brothers
22.article_body: After trailer launch of 'The Gray Man', Joe and Anthony Russo said that fans can expect a new film starring actor Dhanush's character in lead soon. While talking about his character, they said, "He plays one of the...top assassins [in] the world and has two major fight blocks in the film...Dhanush has...great camera presence and we loved seeing him perform."

23.title: 'Evidence too sketchy': HC grants PDP leader bail in terror case
23.article_body: PDP leader Waheed Para was granted bail in a terror conspiracy case by the High Court of Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday. "The evidence as is gathered by the prosecution is too sketchy to be believed prima facie true," said the court. The bench cited the Supreme Court's recent ruling on sedition while granting the relief.

24.title: Musk pledges $6.25 billion more in equity to fund Twitter deal
24.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has pledged an additional $6.25 billion in equity financing to fund the $44-billion offer for Twitter. He is also in talks with Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey and others to help finance the deal. Shares of Twitter rose more than 5% hours after the news of Musk's commitment broke, while Tesla shares dipped about 1%.

25.title: Bypolls to 3 Lok Sabha, 7 Assembly seats across 6 states on June 23: EC
25.article_body: Bypolls to three Lok Sabha seats and seven Assembly seats across six states will be held on June 23, the Election Commission said on Wednesday. The three Lok Sabha seats are Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh and Rampur and Punjab's Sangrur. The seven Assembly seats are Delhi's Rajinder Nagar, Jharkhand's Mandar, Andhra Pradesh's Atmakur, Tripura's Agartala, Town Bordowali, Surma and Jubarajnagar.

26.title: I'm his huge fan, I'm not planning to dethrone him: Siddhant on Varun Dhawan
26.article_body: When asked if he plans to dethrone actor Varun Dhawan, actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said, "I'm his huge fan. It's nothing that I'm planning to dethrone him. I've...few fans and he has a huge fan following, so we can go in for some barter." "I think it's not a fight of fans, it's a fight for good content," he added.

27.title: It was a special day, guys put in a special performance: Du Plessis on win vs LSG
27.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis said it was a "special day" as they defeated LSG in the IPL 2022 Eliminator. Praising batter Rajat Patidar for his unbeaten 112-run innings, Plessis said, "His hundred was one of the best I've seen in the IPL." He added, "We were very happy as a group...We didn't feel like it was a big game."

28.title: Pedestrian stoned to death by 2 motorcycle-borne youths in Pune
28.article_body: A 30-year-old pedestrian in Pune was allegedly stoned to death by two youths on Hadapsar-Mundhwa road on Tuesday. According to police, the accused were riding a two-wheeler which hit the pedestrian from behind. Following this, the deceased and accused reportedly engaged in a verbal fight and one of the accused took a stone and hit the victim on the head.

29.title: Work ethics in B'wood still slipshod, totally different in South: Dalip
29.article_body: Actor Dalip Tahil said the work ethics in Bollywood are still "slipshod", adding it's totally different in the South Indian film industry. "Scripts are not ready in time, the availability, changing schedules...they are all a part and parcel of films," stated Dalip. "From my experience of working in South Indian films, it is a far better oiled machinery," he said.

30.title: Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi service to halt at Gateway of India after monsoon
30.article_body: The water taxi services between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai, which started in February this year, will have a stoppage at the Gateway of India after monsoon, officials said. Currently, the Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi service operates between Domestic Cruise Terminal (DCT) at Ferry Wharf in Mazgaon and Belapur jetty. This step is taken to attract higher footfall, an official said.

31.title: BMC issues danger alert to slums in Mumbai's landslide-prone areas
31.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued a danger alert to residents of the slums in Mumbai's S ward area and asked them to move to a safer place. In case of any accident or loss of life or property due to natural calamity, the BMC will not be responsible for it, a civic notice said.

32.title: Mumbai records 295 new COVID-19 cases, highest in 3 months
32.article_body: Mumbai on Wednesday recorded 295 new COVID-19 infections, the highest in the last three months. Of the 295 new patients, 12 are admitted to hospitals, according to data by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). With 1,531 active cases, Mumbai's test positivity rate (TPR) stood at 3.2%. However, no new death was reported due to the virus on Wednesday, data showed.

33.title: Twitter investors vote against re-electing Musk-backer Durban to board
33.article_body: Twitter investors on Wednesday voted against re-electing co-head of private equity firm Silver Lake Egon Durban, who has been a backer of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms, to the board at an annual meeting. They re-elected Patrick Pichette, a general partner at Inovia Capital, to the board. The shareholders also voted against annual elections for directors, or declassifying the board.

34.title: Hyd woman cheated of ₹10 lakh on pretext of getting medical seat, 1 held
34.article_body: Hyderabad Police arrested a man for cheating a woman of ₹10.16 lakh on the pretext of providing her medical seat at KIMS in Bengaluru. The accused was arrested in Bihar and has been brought to Hyderabad on a transit warrant, police added. "After receiving the money, the accused switched off his mobile phone and cheated her," police further said.

35.title: Yasin Malik's crimes meant to strike at the heart of the idea of India: NIA court
35.article_body: An NIA court in Delhi which handed life term to Kashmiri separatist Yasin Malik in a case related to terrorism and secessionist activities said that his crimes "intended to strike at the heart of the idea of India". "The crime becomes more serious as it was committed with the assistance of foreign powers and designated terrorists," the court added.

36.title: Karnataka reports 208 new COVID-19 cases; 197 in Bengaluru alone
36.article_body: Karnataka on Wednesday recorded 208 new COVID-19 cases and zero coronavirus-related deaths. Of the total cases, 197 infections were reported from Bengaluru alone. The city also reported 118 recoveries the same day. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 1,730 with a positivity rate of 1.13%, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP).

37.title: Stray dogs in Delhi a neglected lot, must look after them: HC
37.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday said that stray dogs in the national capital are a neglected lot and that it is necessary to look after them. Hearing a plea seeking regular supply of vaccines for stray dogs against diseases like canine distemper and parvovirus, the court asked the Delhi government to respond within six weeks.

38.title: Suryakumar Yadav clarifies his 'amazing attitude' tweet for Parag after facing criticism
38.article_body: Cricketer Suryakumar Yadav clarified his 'amazing attitude on the field' tweet for RR batting all-rounder Riyan Parag after several fans criticised him for his tweet. Fans criticised Suryakumar citing Parag getting angry on the field on couple of occasions during RR's Qualifier 1 match against GT. Suryakumar clarified that the tweet was for his fielding and asked fans to "chill".

39.title: Sidhu put on paper work in Patiala jail, would help maintain records: Official
39.article_body: After being sent to jail for a year in connection with road rage case of 1988, Navjot Singh Sidhu has been put on "paper work", an official said. The official also mentioned that Sidhu will be assisting in maintaining jail records while doing a clerical job. Reports said a board of doctors has recommended a seven-meal diet for Sidhu.

40.title: It's obvious, we let ourselves down in the field: Rahul on defeat vs RCB
40.article_body: After their 14-run defeat against RCB in the IPL 2022 Eliminator, LSG captain KL Rahul said their fielding let them down in the match. "It's quite obvious, the reasons why we didn't win. We let ourselves down in the field. Dropping easy catches never helps," Rahul stated. "It's a new franchise...Have to try and come back stronger," he added.

41.title: Pistol found in student's car near US school a day after 18-yr-old killed 19 kids
41.article_body: Police in US' Texas have arrested a school student after a pistol and a replica rifle were found in his car that was parked near the campus. "The juvenile suspect was charged with Unlawful Carrying Weapons in a Weapon-Free School Zone," police said. This comes a day after an 18-year-old killed 19 kids at an elementary school in Texas.

42.title: Apple to raise hourly workers' starting pay in US to at least $22: WSJ
42.article_body: Apple has informed its employees that it will be increasing the starting pay for hourly workers to a minimum of $22 per hour, and higher in certain markets, the Wall Street Journal reported. The new starting wage represents a 45% increase compared to 2018. Starting salaries in the US are also expected to increase.

43.title: 2 charred to death as van overturns and catches fire in Ghaziabad
43.article_body: A man and woman were charred to death and four others were injured as the van they were travelling in overturned and caught fire on Delhi-Meerut Expressway in Ghaziabad, police said. "Prima facie...driver tried to avoid ramming into a scooty...its CNG cylinder caught fire," police added. All victims are residents of Haridwar and are related to each other, police stated.

44.title: Man impersonates Delhi Police official to impress girlfriend, arrested
44.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested by police near Noida Sector-15's Sangam Hotel for allegedly impersonating a Delhi Police personnel to impress his girlfriend. The accused, Rahul Sharma, donned an assistant sub-inspector's uniform and was loitering in the area for over two hours, which made on-duty police officials suspicious. Police recovered two pairs of uniforms and two badges from Sharma.

45.title: Travel in bus once a week, submit feedback: Delhi govt to officials
45.article_body: The Delhi government on Wednesday directed all group A and B officers of the Transport Department and the Delhi Transport Corporation to travel by bus at least once a week and submit feedback on their experience. "There is no way to constantly improve than from the feedback we give ourselves," said Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot while tweeting about the order.

46.title: RCB knock LSG out of IPL 2022, to face RR for place in final
46.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 14 runs in IPL 2022 Eliminator. The match witnessed RCB batter Rajat Patidar slam IPL 2022's fastest hundred off 49 deliveries. RCB will now face Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Qualifier 2 on Friday. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will face Gujarat Titans (GT) in the final on Sunday.

47.title: Govt on course to privatise two public sector banks: Report
47.article_body: The government is committed to the privatisation of two public sector banks (PSBs) and will take the steps required in the coming months, PTI reported. As per its sources, Central Bank of India and Indian Overseas Bank are the likely candidates for privatisation. The government had announced its intent to take up the privatisation of two PSBs in Budget 2021-22.

48.title: Indigo's net loss widens to ₹1,681.8 crore in Q4, income rises 29%
48.article_body: India's biggest airline Indigo on Wednesday reported a net loss of ₹1,681.8 crore in the quarter ending March 31, 2022. This year's Q4 loss was 46.6% more than the loss incurred by the airline in the corresponding period a year ago. Meanwhile, its total income for the quarter jumped 29% y-o-y to ₹8,207.5 crore from ₹6,361.8 crore in Q4 FY21.

49.title: Power Ministry seeks 2-yr extension to emissions deadline: Report
49.article_body: The Power Ministry has sought a two-year extension for the installation of emission-cutting equipment in thermal power plants, Reuters reported. The government initially had set a 2017 deadline but later changed it to varying deadlines for different regions, ending in 2022. Thermal power companies account for some 80% of India's industrial emissions of sulphur- and nitrous-oxides, Reuters said.

50.title: YouTube can do more to combat misinformation: CEO Wojcicki
50.article_body: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki on Tuesday said the video-streaming platform can further improve its work to combat misinformation. "There will always be incentives for people to be creating misinformation...The challenge will be to keep staying ahead of that," she stated. She added that in enforcing its policies, YouTube is missing only about 10 to 12 content-violating videos per 1,00,000 views.

51.title: Would've been nice, but $10 bn was too much: KM Birla on Holcim deal
51.article_body: Aditya Birla Group Chairperson Kumar Mangalam Birla on Wednesday said his company couldn't acquire Holcim's Indian business "primarily due to pricing issue". He stated, "It'd have been nice to have clinched the Holcim deal...[But] $10 billion was too high a price." Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC was eventually taken over by Adani Group in a $10.5 billion deal.

52.title: Postmaster robs 24 families' fixed deposits for IPL betting in MP, loses ₹1 crore
52.article_body: A sub-postmaster in Madhya Pradesh, named Vishal Ahirwar, robbed 24 families' fixed deposits to bet in IPL and has lost ₹1 crore. His crime came to light when some depositors tried to withdraw their money but were told that their FDs were not in the record. He had issued genuine passbooks for fake fixed deposit accounts.

53.title: Take action against 'corrupt' ministers: K'taka AAP to state govt
53.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party in Karnataka challenged the ruling BJP government to take action against 'corrupt' ministers. This comes a day after Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed on the charges of corruption. "We (AAP)...have filed several complaints over 40% commission charges sought by the BJP ministers," AAP state convener Prithvi Reddy said, demanding ouster of "tainted ministers".

54.title: All the best: Ashwani Kumar as Kapil Sibal quits Congress
54.article_body: Former Union Minister and former Congress leader Ashwani Kumar wished Kapil Sibal 'all the best' after he quit the Congress party. "Every person has the right to decide his strategy and political strategy according to his conscience," Ashwani Kumar said. "After the 'Chintan Shivir', there are many people who have said goodbye to the party," he added.

55.title: Happy birthday to the funniest guy I know: Preity Zinta to Karan Johar
55.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta, taking to Instagram, shared a picture with filmmaker Karan Johar and wished him on his 50th birthday. "Happy 50th birthday to the funniest guy I know," she wrote. "Karan, you're not only the king of bling but also the king of emotion and wit," she added. Karan directed Preity in 'Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna'.

56.title: No urgency in hearing plea challenging Talaq-e-Hasan practice: SC
56.article_body: The Supreme Court said there is no urgency in hearing the plea challenging Talaq-e-Hasan practice and asked the petitioner to bring it up next week. As per Talaq-e-Hasan, a Muslim man can divorce his wife by pronouncing "talaq" once a month for three months. A plea has been moved in the Supreme Court seeking to declare Talaq-e-Hasan as unconstitutional.

57.title: CM Baghel unveils memorial of Jhiram valley Naxal attack victims
57.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel inaugurated 'Jhiram Ghati Shaheed Smarak' in Jagdalpur, built in the memory of Congress leaders and others killed in a Naxal attack in Bastar's Jhiram valley in 2013. He also unfurled the tricolour on a 100-foot-high flag post. Baghel accused the BJP of trying to hamper the state government's efforts to unearth the conspiracy behind the attack.

58.title: Karti Chidambaram summoned by CBI in bribe-for-visa case
58.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has been summoned by the CBI for questioning in connection with the bribe-for-visa case. Punjab-based Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd allegedly paid Chidambaram and his close aide S Bhaskararaman ₹50 lakh for re-issuance of project visas for 263 Chinese workers in 2011. The Enforcement Directorate also filed case against Chidambaram on Wednesday.

59.title: Sikkim temporarily bans pigs' sale due to African Swine Fever cases
59.article_body: The Sikkim government has temporarily banned the sale of pigs as African Swine Fever cases have been reported in the North Sikkim district, an official said. As many as 117 pigs have died in the state in the last two months. The Animal Husbandry Department has asked people to refrain from eating pork.

60.title: 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen Bhat shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir
60.article_body: Terrorists fired upon a 35-year-old woman named Amreen Bhat at her residence in Budgam, Jammu & Kashmir today. She was shifted to hospital in injured condition where doctors declared her dead. Her 10-year-old nephew who was also at home received bullet injury on his arm. Three terrorists of terror outfit LeT were involved in the incident, said police.

61.title: Kanye was difficult to live with, I'm really into Pete: Caitlyn Jenner
61.article_body: Caitlyn Jenner, speaking about Kim Kardashian's relationship with ex-husband Kanye West, has said that the rapper was "very difficult" to live with. She added that she's "really into" Kim's current boyfriend Pete Davidson. "We have a comedian in the family. Yay! We don't need more rappers. We need a comedian in the family," she stated.

62.title: Hungarian govt extends emergency powers amid Ukraine invasion
62.article_body: The Hungarian government has passed a constitutional amendment giving itself emergency powers to deal with the "constant threat" posed by the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, PM Viktor Orban has said. The amendment will permit PM Orban to enact laws by decree without parliamentary oversight. Orban stated that the powers would help the government protect Hungarians by "any means possible".

63.title: Punjab govt will present paperless budget, it'll save ₹21 lakh: CM
63.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said that his government will present a paperless budget this time. Mann described the move as a step towards e-governance. "With this, around ₹21 lakh of the state exchequer will be saved [and] 34 tonne paper will be saved...it means it will save 814-834 trees," he tweeted.

64.title: Burkina Faso seizes 115 kg of cocaine worth $11.5 mn from vehicle
64.article_body: Customs officers in Burkina Faso seized a record haul of around 115 kilograms of cocaine last week, the Directorate General of Customs said on Wednesday. The seized drugs, estimated to be worth more than $11.5 million, were reportedly hidden in a vehicle. All smugglers on board escaped from the scene and no arrests have been made, a Customs spokesman said.

65.title: Man accuses wife of domestic violence, tearing his clothes in Raj; video surfaces
65.article_body: A 32-year-old man in Rajasthan's Bhiwadi has accused his wife of domestic violence, stating, "My wife tears off my clothes, thrashes me for no reason." He has also approached a court in Alwar to provide him adequate security. A video has also surfaced, showing the woman beating him up with a bat while he tries to defend himself.

66.title: 28-yr-old woman hires man to kill husband in Delhi, both arrested
66.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-woman was arrested along with the man she hired to kill her husband in Delhi. The accused Chander Kala gave Jumman, a history-sheeter, a hammer and ₹1.5 lakh to kill her husband and tried to make it look like a robbery attempt, the police said. The weapon and ₹50,000 have been recovered, they added.

67.title: Caste-based census will ensure social equality in India: Pawar
67.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar on Wednesday demanded that a caste-based census be conducted nationally, stating that it'll ensure social equality in India. Pawar added that Centre will be able to adequately provide concessions to the OBC community with the help of such a census. Notably, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has convened all-party meet to discuss the issue.

68.title: I was drunk when I first met Big B, he hugged me: Manoj Bajpayee
68.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee revealed that he was drunk when he first met Amitabh Bachchan while the veteran actor had come to attend the screening of Manoj's film. "I was shivering because Amitabh Bachchan was watching my film with his family," he added. Manoj said he asked Amitabh if he could hug him. "And he hugged me," Manoj stated.

69.title: 10-yr-old Bihar girl who lost a leg hops to school for 1 km, Sonu Sood offers help
69.article_body: A video of a 10-year-old girl named Seema hopping to school for one kilometre on one leg in Bihar's Jamui has gone viral. Her leg had to be amputated following an accident two years ago. Offering her help, Sonu Sood tweeted, "Time has come to walk on both feet." The DM also reached Seema's house and gave her a tricycle.

70.title: RCB's Rajat Patidar smashes fastest hundred of IPL 2022
70.article_body: RCB batter Rajat Patidar smashed the fastest hundred of IPL 2022 by reaching the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries against LSG in Eliminator at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. The hundred is Patidar's first in T20 cricket. The previous fastest hundred in IPL 2022 was registered by LSG captain KL Rahul (56 deliveries).

71.title: Was freaking out after Leonardo DiCaprio praised me at Cannes: Urvashi
71.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has said that she fell short of words and was "freaking out" after Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio praised her at the Cannes Film Festival. "I was so emotional and could feel happy tears in my eyes. At the same time I was blushing too," she stated. "He also appreciated me as a very talented actress," Urvashi added.

72.title: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region to issue Russian passports: Official
72.article_body: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia region has begun preparations to issue Russian passports to residents, an official has confirmed. This comes amid Kremlin's new decree mentioning that residents of Ukraine's Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions will be able to acquire Russian passports through a simplified process. Kherson recently introduced Russian rouble as its official currency alongside Ukrainian hryvnia.

73.title: Russian Parliament removes upper age limit for army recruits
73.article_body: Russian Parliament has approved a bill to remove the upper age limit for contractual service in the military to strengthen the armed forces, a report said. Reportedly, only Russians aged 18-40 and foreigners aged 18-30 can enlist as professional soldiers in the Russian military at present. This comes as over 1,000 Russian service personnel had been killed since Ukraine's invasion.

74.title: Rowdy Rathore, Kabir Singh worked better in Hindi than original: Bhushan
74.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about remakes of South Indian films, said, "'Rowdy Rathore'...'Kabir Singh' worked better in Hindi as compared to the original industry." "It's not that all films from South origin are working at pan-India level," he added. Bhushan stated that a film has to be good to work, be it a remake, original or a sequel.

75.title: Beyond our reach: B'luru court to man seeking ₹50 lakh over worms in Cadbury chocolate
75.article_body: A consumer court in Bengaluru has directed a man seeking ₹50 lakh as compensation after finding worms in ₹89 Cadbury chocolate bar to approach the state consumer forum. The court told the man, who filed the complaint in 2016, that the relief he was seeking was beyond its reach. He complained against Cadbury's Indian manufacturer Mondelez India Foods Private Limited.

76.title: Man thrashes wife to death for not cooking rice for him in Thane
76.article_body: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly thrashing his 20-year-old wife to death with a wooden stick for not cooking rice for him in Thane's Bhiwandi. The accused, Shankar Waghmare, a scrap dealer, had married the victim, Jyotsna, a year ago. The couple's neighbours tried to intervene but they found Jyotsna lying in a pool of blood.

77.title: Will talk directly to Putin, not via intermediaries: Ukraine's Prez
77.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday said that he's only willing to talk directly to Russian President Vladimir Putin and not via intermediaries. He further said that if Putin "understands reality", there's the possibility of finding a diplomatic way out of the conflict. Ukraine will fight until it recovers all of its territories, he added.

78.title: Depp never pushed me, kicked me or threw me down any stairs: Ex-girlfriend Kate Moss
78.article_body: British model Kate Moss dismissed reports that her ex-boyfriend Johnny Depp once threw her down a flight of stairs. "He never pushed me, kicked me or threw me down any stairs," said Moss, who was testifying at Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Kate testified that she slipped on a staircase, after which Depp called for medical services.

79.title: Hypergrowth at any cost no longer rewarded: Sequoia to founders
79.article_body: VC firm Sequoia Capital, in an advisory to the founders of its portfolio companies, said, "Era of being rewarded for hypergrowth at any cost...is quickly coming to an end." It added that "money is no longer free" and investors are shifting towards companies that can demonstrate current profitability. It warned companies to not expect quick recovery from current market conditions.

80.title: India has no plans to lift ban on wheat exports for now: Govt
80.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India has no immediate plans to lift a ban on wheat exports. "Currently there is instability in the world, if we were to do that (lift the ban), it would only help black marketeers, hoarders and speculators," Goyal told Reuters. India banned wheat export on May 14.

81.title: No need for lectures on human rights: China's Xi tells UN official
81.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday told UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet that no country has a utopian scenario when it comes to human rights, further stating that "patronising lecturers" aren't needed. Xi also questioned the 'politicisation' of such issues. His remarks come during Bachelet's visit to China amid reports of alleged abuse against Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang province.

82.title: British retailer Marks & Spencer to exit Russia after 17 years
82.article_body: British clothing-to-food retailer Marks and Spencer on Wednesday announced that it will fully exit the Russian market after 17 years. It stopped shipments to Russia in March but earlier stated that complex franchise deals prevented it from withdrawing completely. The company, which has 48 stores there, will face a $39 million hit from its exit, it said.

83.title: 5 NBFCs' registration cancelled due to irregular lending practices
83.article_body: RBI on Wednesday said it has cancelled the Certificate of Registration (CoR) of five non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) due to irregular lending practices. The CoRs were cancelled as the NBFCs violated RBI's Fair Practices Code. The NBFCs were also not complying with extant regulations pertaining to charging of excessive interest and had resorted to undue harassment of customers, RBI said.

84.title: How's 'Prasad' Mr Sibal: BJP's Jitin Prasada as Sibal quits Cong
84.article_body: After Kapil Sibal quit Congress and filed Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support, his ex-party colleague Jitin Prasada asked, "How's the 'Prasad' Mr Sibal!" Prasada, who joined BJP after quitting Congress last year, was referring to Sibal's old tweet. "Jitin Prasada. Joins BJP. The question is will he get 'Prasada' from BJP...?" Sibal had tweeted.

85.title: 10-yr-old student was shot dead by Texas shooter as she tried to call 911
85.article_body: A 10-year-old schoolgirl, Amerie Jo Garza, was shot dead by 18-year-old suspected shooter Salvador Ramos in Texas school as she tried to call 911. Her grandmother said Amerie was calling the emergency services while sitting next to her best friend who was left "covered in her blood". The fourth-grader was one of the 21 victims of the mass shooting.

86.title: Mobile services suspended in Pak's parts amid Imran Khan's Azadi march
86.article_body: Pakistan government has ordered the suspension of mobile services in Punjab's 11 districts in view of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's 'Azadi March' to Islamabad, a report said. This comes after clashes erupted between Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf and police during the march. Police fired tear gas at protesters who were rallying to demand the parliament's dissolution and subsequent general polls.

87.title: Clashes erupt during ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's Azadi march, many held
87.article_body: Several workers of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) were arrested on Wednesday after clashes erupted during Khan's 'Azadi March', which was headed towards Islamabad. Police fired tear gas at protesters who were rallying to demand the parliament's dissolution and subsequent general elections. Khan, who was ousted via a no-trust vote in April, had called for the march.

88.title: Tom Cruise has enormous skill & talent: Actress Jennifer Connelly
88.article_body: Actress Jennifer Connelly praised her 'Top Gun: Maverick' co-star Tom Cruise and said that the actor has "enormous" skill and talent. "He has more enthusiasm...passion and dedication to making movies than anyone I've ever come across," she added. 'Top Gun: Maverick' is the sequel to the 1986 film 'Top Gun'. The film also features Val Kilmer.

89.title: Amazon opens first physical fashion retail store in Los Angeles
89.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday announced that it has opened its first brick-and-mortar clothing retail store, called Amazon Style, in US' Los Angeles. As per Amazon, the store will use machine-learning technology to help customers find clothes and personalise recommendations. Customers shopping on the Amazon app will also have the option to try out their selections at the physical store, it added.

90.title: Maharashtra BJP leaders protest seeking OBC reservation in polls
90.article_body: Nearly 40 BJP workers, including senior party leaders, were detained by the Mumbai Police after they staged a protest against the MVA government, seeking reservation for the OBCs in elections. An official said that the detained BJP workers were taken to Mumbai's Azad Maidan and later released. "This government seeks revenge and behaves like [the] British," BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar said.

91.title: 22-yr-old man killed for resisting robbery attempt in Gurugram
91.article_body: Officials said that the police have booked several unidentified persons for killing 22-year-old Ashish Singh for resisting a robbery attempt in IMT Manesar, Gurugram. The victim suffered grievous injuries to the back of his head, neck, eyes, face and hands, the police said. Singh's family alleged that he was robbed of his cellphone, a silver neck chain and other belongings.

92.title: What are the punishments & fines imposed on Yasin Malik by NIA court?
92.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik was sentenced to life imprisonment and fined ₹10 lakh for offence under Section 17 of UAPA. For offences under Section 121 of IPC, court awarded him life imprisonment and ₹10,000 fine. He also received jail term of 10 years and ₹10,000 fine each for violating Sections 120B, 121A of IPC, Sections 18, 20 of UAPA.

93.title: Clip of Karan Johar's acting debut from 1989 goes viral on his b'day
93.article_body: A video of a 15-year-old Karan Johar making his acting debut has gone viral on social media. The clip is from a 1989 TV show called 'Indradhanush' which also featured Urmila Matondkar. Twitter users shared the clip on the filmmaker's 50th birthday. Karan made his acting debut in Bollywood with Shah Rukh Khan's 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' in 1995.

94.title: Ukraine's Prez offers condolences over Texas school shooting
94.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has offered his condolences to the families of the 21 people who were killed in a shooting at a school in US' Texas. "This is terrible to have victims of shooters in peaceful times," he said. The 18-year-old suspected attacker, who shot and killed the 21 people, including 19 students, was later shot dead by police.

95.title: 42-yr-old K'taka man clears Class 10 exam after 28 yrs along with son
95.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Rahmathulla, in Karnataka passed Class 10 exam with 333 marks after three failed attempts in the last 28 years. His son also cleared the exam and scored 98% marks. Rahmathulla said his son used to teach him after he returned home from work. "This was really one of the biggest moments of my life," he added.

96.title: Which are the top 10 companies in America as per Fortune 500 list?
96.article_body: Walmart has topped the 68th edition of the Fortune 500 ranking of America's largest companies, with $572 billion revenue. It is followed by Amazon and Apple, with $469 billion and $365 billion revenue respectively. The list also features CVS Health, UnitedHealth Group and Exxon Mobil. Berkshire Hathaway, Alphabet, McKesson and AmerisourceBergen are the other companies in the top 10.

97.title: Asaduddin Owaisi is destroying the country like Jinnah: BJP MP
97.article_body: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi is doing the same work of destroying the country that Muhammad Ali Jinnah did before Independence. Accusing Owaisi of trying to mislead the Muslim community, he said, "If Owaisi does not stop the act of breaking the country, then he will have to spend time in the jail only."

98.title: 10 arrested as fake job racket busted in Noida, ₹6 lakh recovered
98.article_body: Police said that they busted a fake job racket in Noida and arrested 10 people for allegedly cheating people with fake job offers. The suspects cheated over 50 people to the tune of ₹20 crore in the last couple of years, the police said. They added that seven laptops, 17 mobile phones and ₹6.74 lakh cash were recovered from them.

99.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in Eliminator, playing XIs announced
99.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in IPL 2022 Eliminator on Wednesday. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Krunal Pandya and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Krishnappa Gowtham and Jason Holder, respectively. Mohammed Siraj has replaced Siddharth Kaul in RCB's playing XI.

100.title: India's Instagram users can now post 3D avatars in Stories, DMs
100.article_body: Instagram-parent Meta on Tuesday launched 3D virtual avatars to be used on Instagram Stories and direct messages (DMs) in India. Meta also released an update for its 3D avatars on Facebook and Messenger app in India, which allows users to create their own virtual selves. The updated avatars include cochlear implants and over-the-ear hearing aids.

101.title: Andhra signs deals worth $16 bn at WEF, to generate 38,000 jobs
101.article_body: Andhra Pradesh signed renewables investment pacts worth $16 billion (around ₹1.2 lakh crore) with  three companies, Adani Green Energy, Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund-backed Greenko and Aurobindo Realty & Infrastructure, during the WEF at Davos. The pacts involve setting up  hydro, solar and wind power related projects in the state. The investments will create 38,000 jobs, an official said.

102.title: 2 Naxals carrying ₹12 lakh reward surrender before Maha Police
102.article_body: Two Naxals carrying a collective reward of ₹12 lakh on their heads surrendered before the Gadchiroli police in Maharashtra, officials said. The Naxals were allegedly involved in various killings, arson and encounters, the officials said. In a press release, Gadchiroli Superintendent of Police Ankit Goyal said that from 2019 till date, 49 hardcore Naxalites have surrendered before him.

103.title: Man beats 22-yr-old wife to death after an argument in Thane
103.article_body: Police said that a man allegedly thrashed his 22-year-old wife to death with a wooden log after a domestic dispute in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Tuesday evening and the 28-year-old accused, Shankar Waghmare, was arrested in the early hours of Wednesday, the police said. The accused has been booked under IPC Section 302 (murder), they added.

104.title: Denmark may give vaccines to close contacts of monkeypox cases: Report
104.article_body: Denmark is considering providing vaccines to close contacts of those who have been infected with monkeypox, Reuters reported quoting the Danish Health Authority. This comes after Denmark confirmed two monkeypox cases in individuals with travel history to Spain. As many as 20 countries, including the US, UK, Israel, Portugal and Switzerland have reported monkeypox cases.

105.title: I want death penalty for him: IAF martyr's wife as Yasin gets life term
105.article_body: The wife of Air Force officer Ravi Khanna, martyred in a terror attack allegedly carried out by Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, said she wasn't satisfied with life imprisonment awarded to him. "I want...death penalty for him in my case," said Nirmal Khanna. A Delhi court has sentenced Malik to life imprisonment in a 2017 terror funding case.

106.title: Yasin Malik's supporters clash with security personnel, pelt stones in Srinagar
106.article_body: Several supporters of Yasin Malik clashed with security personnel and pelted stones outside his residence in Srinagar on Wednesday. The security personnel fired tear gas during the protest, which was held ahead of Malik's sentencing. He has been sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi.

107.title: World's shortest living teenager confirmed as 17-year-old from Nepal, pics released
107.article_body: Dor Bahadur Khapangi (Nepal) has officially been confirmed as the shortest teenager living (male). Khapangi, born on 14 November 2004, is now 17 years old. The measurement took place on 23 March 2022 in Kathmandu, Nepal. Khapangi was confirmed to be an average height of 73.43 cm (2 ft 4.9 in), revealed Guinness World Records.

108.title: Relatives had cut several of my outfits with scissors: Urfi Javed
108.article_body: Urfi Javed recalled an incident when her relatives "took their anger" out on her clothes. "With a pair of scissors, they cut so many of my dresses, saying some showed cleavage while others were sleeveless," she stated. Urfi added most of those relatives now want a selfie with her. "I've always been bold and loved to dress well," she said.

109.title: Filmwaala was filmwaala in our time; not Hindu, Muslim, Sikh: Tanuja
109.article_body: Veteran actress Tanuja, talking about the progress in the film industry, has said that the film industry has become corporate "instead of being a family". "When you become corporate then it becomes very compartmentalized," she added. Tanuja further said, "In our time, filmwaala was just filmwaala...Not a Hindu, Muslim, or Sikh, just filmwaala."

110.title: China conducts military operations near Taiwan
110.article_body: China on Wednesday announced that it had held military operations near Taiwan. This comes after US President Joe Biden said that the US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded the self-ruled island. In response to Biden's remarks, China said that it's a "purely internal affair", adding, "Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory."

111.title: Thieves write 'I love you' on TV after ₹20 lakh theft from Goa home
111.article_body: Thieves broke into a bungalow in Goa and ran away with valuables worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers left an 'I love you' note using a marker on the television screen of the house in Margao town. The house owner had gone out on a two-day holiday when the accused ran away with gold and silver ornaments and cash.

112.title: Lynching-accused are punished in Pak, garlanded in India: Mufti
112.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday compared the judiciaries of India and Pakistan in terms of treatment of lynching cases. "A man was lynched in Pakistan, they sentenced six people to death...Several [people] have been lynched [in India] after 2015...The accused [have been] garlanded, not punished," she said. "That's the difference between their judiciary and [ours]," Mufti added.

113.title: 2 Rafale fighter jets collide mid-air during airshow in France; video surfaces
113.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment two Rafale fighter jets collided mid-air during an airshow in France's Chateaubernard military base on Sunday. The top tail of one of the two jets got severed in the collision, but it managed to land safely. The part of the jet reportedly fell on a house and damaged its roof.

114.title: No petrol in any petrol station in Lahore, no cash in ATM: Ex-Pak cricketer Hafeez
114.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Hafeez took to Twitter to give a glimpse of problems faced by the "common man" in Pakistan. "No petrol available in any petrol station in Lahore??? No cash available in ATM?? Why [does] a common man [have] to suffer from political decisions?" he wrote. He tagged former Pakistan PM Imran Khan and current PM Shehbaz Sharif.

115.title: We will fight back: Brother of dismissed Punjab Health Minister
115.article_body: After Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was dismissed by CM Bhagwant Mann and arrested for corruption, his elder brother said the family is taking the legal recourse to defend Singla. "There's a serious nefarious design to implicate Vijay...It's difficult to identify the perpetrators at the moment, but we'll fight back against the bid to tarnish my brother's image," he added.

116.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik sentenced to life imprisonment in terror funding case
116.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been sentenced to life imprisonment in the 2017 terror funding case by a Delhi court on Wednesday. The NIA had sought death penalty for Malik, who was earlier convicted in the case by the court. Notably, Malik had pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.

117.title: My parents' split hasn't put me off idea of marriage: Shruti Haasan
117.article_body: Speaking about her parents Kamal Haasan and Sarika's marriage, Shruti Haasan said, "When it worked, they were a brilliant couple...that's what I chose to look at." She added that she wouldn't "write off the idea of marriage" just because of her parents' divorce. "It was a fantastic marriage and that's what I chose to take away from it," she stated.

118.title: TMC has culture of bringing Rohingyas: BJP leader Saumitra Khan
118.article_body: BJP leader Saumitra Khan on Wednesday accused the Trinamool Congress (TMC) of propagating "a culture of bringing Rohingyas" to sustain itself in the government in West Bengal. Khan had earlier sought a ban on TMC, alleging that the party is responsible for the influx of Rohingya refugees in India. He had also termed the TMC a "terror supply party".

119.title: 46 held for violence after houses of minister, MLA set afire in AP
119.article_body: Police have arrested 46 people in connection with the violence which broke out in Andhra Pradesh's Amalapuram town over the renaming of the newly created Konaseema district as BR Ambedkar Konaseema district. The houses of a state minister and an MLA were set on fire during Tuesday's violence. Meanwhile, police have tightened the security and deployed additional forces in Amalapuram.

120.title: India likely to get 'normal' monsoon rains this year: IMD
120.article_body: India is likely to get normal seasonal monsoon rainfall this year, said Jayanta Sarkar, Head, India Meteorological Department (IMD) Mumbai. Heatwave conditions are unlikely to prevail over the country and light to moderate rainfall is expected in Konkan and Goa region during the next five days, IMD said on Wednesday. Isolated heavy rainfall likely over some northeastern states, it added.

121.title: India-Pakistan not moving forward, but 1 day we'll engage economically: Pak Min
121.article_body: Pakistan Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari on Wednesday said that his country's relations with India have not been moving forward. "But one day we'll get to the position where international institutions will...ensure the international order. Definitely, there will be a day when we'll be able to engage with our neighbour to the east, not just diplomatically but also economically," he stated.

122.title: Shutdown in parts of Srinagar ahead of court verdict on Yasin Malik
122.article_body: Some areas in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Wednesday as a court was scheduled to give a verdict on the quantum of sentence for separatist leader Yasin Malik, who has been convicted in a terror funding case. Some shops in Maisuma and Lal Chowk were closed. Security forces were deployed in strength to maintain law and order.

123.title: Coinbase becomes first crypto company to get listed on Fortune 500
123.article_body: Coinbase, the San Francisco-based crypto exchange, has become the first cryptocurrency company to break into the Fortune 500 list. Currently ranked at 437, Coinbase has a market value of $41,670 million and over 3,700 employees, as per Fortune. The exchange was singled out by Fortune editor-in-chief Alyson Shontell as one of "several pandemic winners".

124.title: Biden's approval rating falls to 36%, lowest of his presidency: Poll
124.article_body: As Americans suffered from rising inflation, US President Joe Biden's public approval rating fell to 36%, the lowest since he took office in January 2021, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll found. Around 59% of Americans disapproved of Biden's job performance, according to the two-day national poll. Biden's approval rating has been below 50% since August last year.

125.title: He likely moved from last call spot: Official on Delhi man's death in Pune
125.article_body: While talking about Delhi engineer who was found dead after he went missing in a forest in Pune, an official from group specialising in search and rescue, said the man seemingly moved away from location from where he made last call to his friend. The official also advised trekkers to stay at location of last call if they get lost.

126.title: Pune BJP MP supports locals protesting over civic garden's name
126.article_body: Pune BJP MP Girish Bapat on Wednesday extended support to Salisbury Park residents who have been protesting over the renaming of the civic garden. Former BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale had in March put up a board naming the garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale. Residents of Salisbury Park have been protesting against it for the last two months.

127.title: Accused not linked to LeT: Lawyer of Pune man held in terror case
127.article_body: The lawyer of a Pune youth arrested on Tuesday by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) after being accused of having links to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) stated that the youth, Mohammad Junaid, isn't linked to the terror outfit. The 28-year-old suspect has been "brainwashed" and "falsely implicated", the lawyer further said. Junaid has been sent to ATS' custody till June 3.

128.title: Hyderabad hospitals refunded ₹1.61 cr to 87 COVID patients: RTI reply
128.article_body: After complaints of overcharging COVID-19 patients, private hospitals in Hyderabad have refunded over ₹1.61 crore to 87 people between November 2020 and June 2021, as per a reply given to an RTI application. The Director of Public Health and Family Welfare had earlier issued guidelines on hospital tariffs. It had put a limit on various charges.

129.title: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker announces India foray
129.article_body: Cryptocurrency platform CoinTracker has announced its foray into the Indian market. Starting Wednesday, its crypto tax compliance and portfolio tracking products will be available to all crypto users in India. The dropping trading volumes and uncertain crypto regulations in India won't affect the firm as it's not dependent on users to have to transact a lot, said CEO Jon Lerner.

130.title: Prostitution racket busted at Bengaluru spa; 3 women rescued
130.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted a prostitution racket that was allegedly being operated from a spa centre, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly raided the spa centre, Zen Glow Salon Spa and Wellness, and busted the racket. Furthermore, police rescued three women from there and arrested one person.

131.title: We should give equal importance to each language of India: Ayushmann
131.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking over the national language debate, has said, "We really can't keep one language at the forefront." He added India has multiple languages, multiple religions, regions, communities and ethnicities. "We should give equal importance to each language of our nation," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter debate on Hindi being the national language.

132.title: Delhi HC rules out discrimination case by disabled person against Uber
132.article_body: Delhi High Court asked a complainant to delete Uber India from the list of parties named in his discrimination against persons with disability petition. As per Uber, the court said notice needed to be issued to the Centre alone as it'll implement the required directives. The petitioner had alleged an Uber driver refused to keep his wheelchair in his taxi.

133.title: 75 missing, 1 confirmed dead after migrant boat sinks off Tunisia
133.article_body: As many as 75 people went missing after a boat carrying migrants sank off Tunisia on Wednesday, according to the International Organization for Migration. It added that 24 people were rescued from the boat which had departed from Libya. The body of one person was found while the search was on for the others, said a Tunisian security official.

134.title: Narinder Batra resigns as Indian Olympic Association president
134.article_body: Narinder Batra has resigned from the post of Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president. Batra said he took the decision to focus on his role as President of International Hockey Federation (FIH) as "world hockey is going through an essential development phase". "I wish my successor and the whole sports family in India every success in the future!" he added.

135.title: Paramilitary officer hugs Adivi after watching 'Major', video surfaces
135.article_body: In a video that has surfaced online, a paramilitary officer can be seen talking to and hugging actor Adivi Sesh after watching his movie 'Major', that is based on life of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan. The officer, who was in a wheelchair, can be seen showing Adivi how he got goosebumps after watching the film.

136.title: To the man who's my father & best friend: Alia on Karan Johar's 50th b'day
136.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt wished Karan Johar on his 50th birthday. Taking to Instagram, she shared unseen photos with Karan from her wedding. Alongside the post, Alia wrote, "To the most generous soul I know...to the man who is my father...my best friend...and my mentor...Happy 50th birthday K! I pray and wish for only love, peace and joy in your life."

137.title: Steps taken to prevent waterlogging at critical spots in Delhi: PWD
137.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has taken multiple steps to prevent waterlogging during monsoon at critical locations. At least seven critical spots which are prone to waterlogging have been identified out of 145 such locations, senior PWD officials said. The steps include construction of drains and sumps, installation of automated pumps and deployment of additional maintenance vans.

138.title: Will accept hanging if Intel proves my role in terror activities: Yasin Malik
138.article_body: As the National Investigation Agency has urged the court to give death penalty to Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik, he said he'll accept the hanging if Indian Intelligence proved that he had been involved in any terrorist activity or violence in 28 years. "Then, I will also retire from politics," he said.

139.title: My fees was slashed in half as I played mute character, felt disrespected: Manoj
139.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled that he felt disrespected after his fee was slashed in half by a show's producer. Manoj said that filmmaker Anubhav Sinha cast him as a mute man for his show 'Shikast'. He added that when he went to collect his fees after four months, the producer said, "Payment is for dialogues, where are your dialogues?"

140.title: Lift sanctions & we'll allow ships with food to leave Ukraine: Russia
140.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko said Russia is ready to provide a humanitarian corridor for vessels carrying food to leave Ukraine if some sanctions imposed on Moscow are lifted, Interfax reported. Ukraine's Black Sea ports have been blocked since Russia began invading Ukraine. The European Union has accused Russia of using food supplies as a weapon with global repercussions.

141.title: Check untreated waste being released in Ganga: NGT to U'khand govt
141.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) directed the Uttarakhand chief secretary to check discharge of untreated waste into Ganga. The direction came following a petition that claimed agents of municipal corporation in Rishikesh bathed and washed vehicles using the tap installed outside a toilet complex on the banks of river Ganga. NGT further ordered the chief secretary to take remedial action.

142.title: US Open champion Raducanu knocked out of French Open in 2nd round by world no. 47
142.article_body: US Open 2021 champion Emma Raducanu has been knocked out of the French Open 2022 in the second round. The 19-year-old lost the match 6-3, 1-6, 1-6 to world number 47 Aliaksandra Sasnovich of Belarus. Sasnovich has reached the third round of the Roland Garros for the first time in her career.

143.title: Wanted to respect the game even if we lose: Hardik on GT's win vs RR
143.article_body: Discussing GT's win by seven wickets against RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1, GT captain Hardik Pandya said, "We goofed up against MI and wanted to respect the game...even if we lose." "[I] wanted...[me, David Miller] to finish," added Hardik. Talking about his performances with the bat, Hardik stated he hasn't been successful batting at the position of his choice.

144.title: Captain Abhilasha becomes 1st woman officer to join Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator
144.article_body: Captain Abhilasha Barak has created history by becoming the first woman officer to join the Army Aviation Corps as Combat Aviator. "Captain Abhilasha Barak has been awarded the Coveted Wings along with 36 Army Pilots by Director General & Colonel Commandant Army Aviation," the Additional Directorate General of Public Information, IHQ of MoD (Army) tweeted on Wednesday.

145.title: Ate dumplings, that's it: Raducanu on celebrations after US Open 2021 win
145.article_body: Talking about the celebrations after she won the US Open in 2021, Great Britain's tennis player Emma Raducanu said, "There was nothing big or amazing that my parents did to celebrate." "We just came home and ate dumplings, and that was it. We are very normal," added Raducanu. Raducanu became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam title.

146.title: Chandigarh immigration firm owner cheats 15 people of ₹2.29 cr, booked
146.article_body: The owner of a Chandigarh-based immigration firm was booked for allegedly cheating at least 15 people of ₹2.29 crore on the pretext of sending their children abroad on student visas. The accused man took possession of their passports and original documents. Besides the main accused, seven other staff members from the office are under the scanner, police said.

147.title: Violence in TN town after burnt body of fisherwoman found near shrimp farm
147.article_body: The partially burnt body of a 47-year-old fisherwoman was found in an isolated area near a shrimp farm near Vadakadu fishing town in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday. Alleging the deceased was gang-raped and burnt, locals set the farm afire and attacked workers whom they suspected were behind the crime. They've been protesting near taluka office, seeking justice after the incident.

148.title: Satish Kaushik accuses Go First of using 'dubious ways to earn money', says got no refund
148.article_body: Satish Kaushik accused Go First airline of using "dubious ways" to earn money. Kaushik said his office booked two seats "in first row with middle seat" and paid ₹25,000. He alleged the flight sold middle seat to another passenger despite his office paying for it. Kaushik added his office has been contacting customer care and their reply was 'no refund'.

149.title: Pay more attention: Ethereum Co-founder on recent crypto crash
149.article_body: People must pay more attention to what is belying the currency name when they get involved, said Ethereum's Co-founder Gavin Wood with regard to the recent crypto crash which wiped $800 billion off their value. The crypto crash led to Terra's LUNA crypto token crashing nearly 100%. "The internet has no real concept of legality," Wood added.

150.title: People come & go from Congress: Venugopal on Kapil Sibal's exit
150.article_body: Reacting to ex-Union Minister Kapil Sibal's exit from Congress, party leader KC Venugopal said "people come and go" from Congress. "[Sibal] had already written a letter to...party president...[it said] that he firmly believed in...Congress' values," he stated. Sibal, who was affiliated with Congress for over 30 years, filed nomination for Rajya Sabha polls with Samajwadi Party's support today.

151.title: 6 civilians killed in Ukraine by Russian shelling: Governor
151.article_body: At least six civilians were killed by Russian shelling in Severodonetsk city in eastern Ukraine, Governor of the Luhansk region, Serhiy Haidai, said on Wednesday. Haidai added that another eight people were injured in the last 24 hours in the city. He claimed that the Russian forces were deliberately attacking the shelters where civilians were hiding.

152.title: IPL betting racket busted in B'luru; 1 held, over ₹2 lakh seized
152.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have busted an IPL betting racket, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Wednesday. Police have also arrested a man for his alleged involvement in illegal betting on a cricket match between SunRisers Hyderabad and Punjab Kings. Police have seized over ₹2,00,000 in cash, a mobile phone and other items from his possession.

153.title: Punjab govt hikes milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat
153.article_body: The Punjab government announced an increase in milk procurement prices by ₹55 per kg fat for dairy farmers. The increase in milk procurement prices will not have any impact on retail milk prices, said Punjab minister Harpal Singh Cheema. This decision comes after dairy farmers held a massive protest at a state-owned milk plant in Mohali, seeking hike in price.

154.title: You'll always be in my heart: Sanjay on dad Sunil Dutt's death anniversary
154.article_body: Marking the death anniversary of his father, Sunil Dutt, actor Sanjay Dutt on Wednesday shared a post for him on his social media. Sharing a throwback picture of them, Sanjay wrote, "Through thick and thin, you were always there to guide and protect me. You were my strength...in every need...You will always be in my heart Dad, I miss you."

155.title: Assam man carries illegal weapons to SP office; arrested
155.article_body: Assam Police arrested a man from the Nagaon district on Wednesday for allegedly carrying illegal weapons to the office of Superintendent of Police (SP) Leena Doley. They also recovered a pistol, six bullets along with two mobile handsets from his possession. "Arrested man already has cases of extortion and dacoity filed against him," the SP said.

156.title: Many uniting for 2024: Sibal on filing RS nomination with SP’s support
156.article_body: After resigning from Congress and filing Rajya Sabha nomination with SP's support, Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said many people are coming together for 2024 when the Lok Sabha polls are scheduled to be held. "We, many people, are coming together for 2024. We will expose the shortcomings of the central government ahead of 2024," Sibal added.

157.title: Future plans are to unite Opposition to oppose BJP: Kapil Sibal
157.article_body: Soon after resigning from Congress, Kapil Sibal said that his future plans are to unite the Opposition to oppose the BJP. Sibal added that the BJP is following "anti-people policies" and is "dividing" the inclusive culture of India. "We (the Opposition) want to create an alliance so that we can oppose the (PM) Modi-led government," Sibal said after his resignation.

158.title: 9-ft-long alligator missing top half of its snout spotted in US; pic surfaces
158.article_body: A nine-foot-long alligator with missing top half of its snout was spotted in a lake in the US' Florida. "I saw this gator far away and he looked weird to me...The whole end of his top jaw is missing...By the looks of him, he's doing alright though," the woman who first spotted it said in a post.

159.title: Not everything is misleading like your birthdate: Mishra to Afridi for defending Yasin
159.article_body: Reacting to ex-Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi calling terror charges against Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik "fabricated", cricketer Amit Mishra tweeted, "Dear Afridi...he himself has pleaded guilty in court on record." He added, "Not everything is misleading like your birthdate." Yasin was convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty.

160.title: Country Delight raises $108 million at $615 million valuation
160.article_body: D2C fresh foods brand Country Delight has raised $108 million in series D funding led by Venturi Partners and Temasek, at a valuation of $615 million. Others who participated in the round include, SWC Global and Trifecta Capital, IIFL Asset Management, Elevation Capital, Orios Venture Partners and Matrix Partners. The round takes the company's total funding to $147 million.

161.title: Delhi Transport Minister inaugurates 3 automated driving test tracks
161.article_body: Delhi government has started three automated driving tracks for people to take the test for obtaining their driving licence. Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday inaugurated the three tracks in Mayur Vihar, Shakur Basti and Vishwas Nagar. The tracks have been opened for people who are unable to spare time during the day, an official said.

162.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill to close 'unfriendly' foreign news outlets
162.article_body: Russian lower house of Parliament passed a bill giving prosecutors powers to shut foreign media outlets in Moscow if a nation has been "unfriendly" to Russian media. This follows the closure of some Russian state news outlets in the West. The bill needs to be reviewed by upper house of Parliament and signed by President Vladimir Putin to become law.

163.title: Had to handle kids during Mr India, now they say 'you were so strict': Satish
163.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik said that he had the task of handling all the children who were part of 'Mr India'. "I had to train the children for the performances, I nearly took a whip to them to collect them. Now they say, 'Satish uncle, you were so strict.' I used to shout at them during the shooting also," he added.

164.title: Producers didn't want to work with me, it changed post 'The Kashmir...': Darshan
164.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar, who was recently seen in 'The Kashmir Files', spoke about how things changed after the film's success at the box office. He said, "Directors were always keen on working with me but the producers weren't ready to commit." "Earlier...the same people who didn't want to invest in my...projects are now casting me as...lead in films," he added.

165.title: Sandalwood smuggler Veerappan's elder brother dies at hospital in Salem
165.article_body: Madhaiyan, the elder brother of sandalwood smuggler Veerappan, died of a cardiac arrest at a hospital in Salem on Wednesday morning, police said. Madhaiyan was admitted to the hospital on May 1 following complaints of severe chest pain. He had been sentenced to a life term in connection with the murder of a forest ranger in 1987.

166.title: Centre trying to impose Gujarat-model everywhere: Mehbooba Mufti
166.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the central government by saying that the Centre is trying to indulge in "communal politics" and impose Gujarat-model everywhere as it has nothing to offer to youths. "If Centre has strategies like Hitler against the Muslims then it should have the courage to reveal what they want to do with them at once," Mufti added.

167.title: Waited for 6-7 hours, he was busy: Ayushmann on why he couldn't meet SRK
167.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana opened up about what would've been his first-ever meeting with actor Shah Rukh Khan. He said, "I remember our first meeting. I was doing radio and I had to interview him. I couldn't interview him because he was shooting for...ad film." "I waited for 6-7 hours...he was busy. I had to...go back to the studio," he added.

168.title: Ashwin keeps proving people wrong, has been a revolution for RR: Jaffer
168.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has been a revolution for RR in IPL 2022, adding that he keeps on proving people wrong. "Whatever the role you put him in, you find him acing that well," stated Jaffer. Ashwin currently has a strike rate of 146.82 in IPL 2022. He has picked 11 wickets so far.

169.title: Delhi civic body releases 1 month's salary, pension of all employees
169.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi has released one month's salary and pension of all employees and pensioners, officials said on Tuesday. "The corporation has made a fund of ₹432.84 crore available for this purpose," a senior MCD official said. The teachers of municipal schools had not been paid salaries for the past six months, AAP had alleged.

170.title: 21-yr-old man beaten to death by girlfriend’s family in Madhya Pradesh
170.article_body: A 21-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death by his girlfriend's family members after they caught the duo in an objectionable state in a field, a police official in Madhya Pradesh's Indore said on Tuesday. The body of the deceased, identified as Vinod Chouhan, was found in the Khudail area. "The girl's parents and brother are missing," police said.

171.title: KSRTC bus conductor slaps woman after argument in B'luru; arrested
171.article_body: Police have arrested a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus conductor for allegedly assaulting a 39-year-old woman passenger near Dasarahalli bus stand in Bengaluru. According to a report, the conductor allegedly slapped the woman after a heated argument broke out between them on Tuesday. Meanwhile, some senior KSRTC officials met the woman and apologised to her for the incident.

172.title: 'Sorry' painted in red, bold letters all over school and street in Bengaluru; pics surface
172.article_body: Miscreants painted 'sorry' in red, bold letters all over the premises of a school and nearby street in Bengaluru, pictures of which have surfaced online. "Two bike-borne persons were seen in the CCTV footage. Efforts on to identify and trace them," police said. The school authorities have not filed any complaint, according to reports.

173.title: Why shouldn't BJP be an option: Hardik Patel after quitting Congress
173.article_body: When asked if the Bharatiya Janata Party is an option for him after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" When asked if he has an offer from a party, he said, "Offers and bargains are for weak people...Strong people create a space for themselves." Patel also added there is no clarity about where he will go.

174.title: Woman finds diamond worth ₹10 lakh in Madhya Pradesh mine
174.article_body: A woman named Chameli Bai has found a 2.08-carat diamond in a mine she took on lease in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district, said Anupam Singh, an official from diamond office. It may fetch up to ₹10 lakh in auction, he said. It will be put up for sale and the price will be fixed as per government guidelines, he added.

175.title: What are gun laws in US' Texas as 18-yr-old kills 19 kids at school?
