175.article_body: According to gun laws in US' Texas, to carry a handgun in public without a license, a person must be at least 21 years old and shouldn't have a prior felony conviction. The laws do not specifically put restrictions on who can carry a long gun such as rifle. On Tuesday, an 18-year-old killed 19 students at a Texas school.

176.title: Anthony Russo & I are Dhanush fans: 'The Gray Man' director Joe Russo
176.article_body: 'The Gray Man' director Joe Russo, speaking about actor Dhanush, has said, "Anthony [Russo] and I are Dhanush's fans." "We wrote this role specifically for him. He's a...classic badass character, who shows up to combat the hero and complicate the film," Joe added. The filmmaker added Dhanush plays a top assassin and has "two incredible fights" in 'The Gray Man'.

177.title: Meeting someone abroad is act of courtesy: Tharoor on Rahul-Corbyn meet
177.article_body: Following Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and British MP Jeremy Corbyn's meet, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said meeting someone abroad is an act of courtesy. "It does not imply endorsement of all his ideas and views," Tharoor tweeted. "When visiting a democracy, meeting leaders from Opposition parties is a normal process, especially when the visitor is from a democracy too," Tharoor added.

178.title: Climate change causing people to sleep less, finds study
178.article_body: According to a study, by 2099, about 50-58 hours of sleep per person per year could be reduced due to climate change. People tend to sleep around 14 minutes less every day as the temperatures rise, the study that analysed sleep data of over 47,000 people stated. "The probability of having...short night...sleep increased as nights became hotter," a researcher said.

179.title: Fewer Indians use newspapers, magazines, radio and TV: NFHS
179.article_body: Fewer Indians use traditional mass media like newspapers, magazines, radio and TV for news and entertainment, a comparison of 2019-21 data by National Family Health Survey (NFHS) to that of 2015-16 showed. While 25% of women and 14% of men said they were not regularly exposed to mass media in 2015-2016, the trend rose to 41% and 32% in 2019-21.

180.title: Heartbroken: Pope on Texas school shooting, calls for weapon control
180.article_body: Pope Francis said that he's "heartbroken" by the shooting at a school in US' Texas that claimed lives of 21 people, including 19 students, on Wednesday. "It's time to say 'enough' to...indiscriminate trafficking of weapons. Let us all make a commitment so that tragedies like this cannot happen again," he added. The 18-year-old suspected attacker was shot dead by police.

181.title: Cabinet approves sale of govt's stake in Hindustan Zinc: Report
181.article_body: The Union Cabinet has approved sale of the Centre's entire residual stake in Hindustan Zinc Limited, Moneycontrol reported citing CNBC Awaaz. The government owns a 29.5% stake in the mining company, while Vedanta Limited holds a 64.92% stake. At current market price, the government's residual stake in Hindustan Zinc is valued at around ₹38,740 crore.

182.title: Advanced economies to be back on track by 2024: IMF's Gopinath
182.article_body: International Monetary Fund's First Deputy MD Gita Gopinath on Wednesday said advanced economies will be back on track by 2024, but developing economies would be 5% below where they would've been otherwise. "Prices of commodities including fuel and food are going up around the world," Gopinath said. Central banks are trying to tackle this high level of inflation, she added.

183.title: Prez Kovind to attend anniversary celebrations in Pune's Datta Mandir
183.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will on Friday attend the launch of the 125th-anniversary celebrations of the Laxmibai Dagdusheth Halwai Datta Mandir Trust in Pune. Former President Pratibha Patil will also be present on the occasion, the trust's head Pratap Pardeshi said. The event will be attended by Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

184.title: Sri Lankan PM sworn in as Finance Minister amid economic crisis
184.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Finance, Economic Stabilisation and National Policies Minister before President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday, the President's office announced. Wickremesinghe will now lead talks with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) as the crisis-hit country seeks a bailout. The country is undergoing its worst economic crisis since independence in 1948.

185.title: Why am I called a Bengali actress, why not an Indian actress: Swastika
185.article_body: Amid the ongoing language debate in Indian cinema, Swastika Mukherjee questioned those using the term Bengali actress instead of Indian actress. She said, "What's 'Bengali actress'? Does anyone write 'Hindi actress' for those whose mother tongue is Hindi? Does every actor working in Bollywood hail from Mumbai?" "What's your problem with referring [to] people as Indian actresses?" she added.

186.title: Two top execs of Singapore-based Grab's fintech unit quit: Report
186.article_body: Singapore-based Grab's Chris Yeo, Head of GrabPay and GrabRewards, is leaving along with Jeffrey Goh, who leads its payments gateway business, Reuters reported citing sources. The exits follow Grab reporting a loss of $3.6 billion in 2021 from $2.7 billion a year earlier. Yeo has been with the firm for nearly six years.

187.title: Delhi HC acquits 5 molestation-murder convicts giving benefit of doubt
187.article_body: Delhi High Court has acquitted five molestation-murder convicts giving them the benefit of doubt. The court added that the testimony of the eyewitness was not truthful in connection with a case of molestation and murder of a woman in Uttam Nagar in March 2014. The appellant had been awarded a life sentence in 2019 by the trial court.

188.title: DNA samples sought from parents to identify some victims in Texas school shooting
188.article_body: Some of the parents of 19 children shot dead in an elementary school shooting in US' Texas have been asked to give their DNA samples to identify the victims, local media reported. A journalist also shared a video of the parents, stating that they were going one by one to get swabbed by investigators. The 18-year-old gunman was shot dead.

189.title: 19 kids killed by 18-yr-old shooter at US school were 2 days away from summer break
189.article_body: The 19 kids killed at a school in US' Texas were two days away from their summer break. The school serves about 570 children in second through fourth grades, nearly 90% of them Hispanic. Salvador Ramos shot his grandmother before fleeing and crashing his car near Robb Elementary School in Uvalde and killing at least 21 people.

190.title: ED books Karti Chidambaram for money laundering in Chinese visa case
190.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has booked Congress MP Karti Chidambaram and others in connection with a money laundering case related to issuance of visas to 263 Chinese nationals in 2011. The agency said that it filed the case taking cognisance of an FIR by CBI in the matter. Chidambaram and his associate have been accused of taking ₹50 lakh bribe.

191.title: Mohali woman consumes poison & dies, husband booked for abetment
191.article_body: A man has been booked by Phase 11 police in Mohali for abetment to suicide after his wife consumed poison and died. Her father said in his complaint that his daughter consumed poison under stress as her husband demanded money from her to buy a car. The deceased woman was married for around a year and a half.

192.title: I wish I had played at least some cricket in childhood: Anushka on 'Chakda..'
192.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to her Instagram Stories to share her picture while preparing for her upcoming movie 'Chakda 'Xpress'. "I wish I had played at least some cricket in my childhood, perhaps then I would not have suffered like this today," she wrote. Anushka will be playing cricketer Jhulan Goswami in the movie.

193.title: BJP leaders detained in Andhra over protest to rename Jinnah Tower
193.article_body: Several BJP members, including National Secretary Sunil Deodhar, were detained by police on Tuesday in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur. They reportedly marched towards the Jinnah Tower, demanding that the tower be renamed after India's former President Dr APJ Abdul Kalam. Condemning the arrests, BJP Rajya Sabha member GVL Narasimha Rao tweeted, "Wondering if we're in AP [Andhra Pradesh] or in Pakistan?"

194.title: Was asked 'When will you go to your country': Northeastern actress Andrea
194.article_body: Actress Andrea Kevichusa, who is from Nagaland, recalled a make-up artist being unaware that the state was a part of India. "I was probably about 16 years of age and I remember telling the makeup artist that I have a flight to Nagaland...And she was like, 'Oh is it? When are you going back to your country?'" she added.

195.title: Gujarat govt to soon launch India's first carbon trading market
195.article_body: Gujarat government has announced plans for setting up India's first cap-and-trade market for carbon emissions. The market will help industries that are unable to meet their emission targets to trade and purchase surplus targets from other industries which have met their goals. Gujarat government has also been running the world's first Emissions Trading Market for Particulate Pollution since 2019.

196.title: E-bus breaks down in Delhi hrs after being flagged off by Kejriwal
196.article_body: Just a few hours after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flagged off 150 electric buses on Tuesday, one of the new e-buses broke down near a Rohini bus depot, a report said. Meanwhile, Delhi Transport Corporation said the bus stopped automatically after its temperature rose beyond the specified limit. "[Response] team...attended the bus...put it on road within two hours," DTC added.

197.title: Manchester United owners in talks to buy East Bengal: Sourav Ganguly
197.article_body: Manchester United owners are in talks to buy East Bengal, one of the oldest football clubs in India, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly confirmed. "We've spoken to them and others also. It will take 10-12 more days to know who will be the entity," Ganguly added. In April, East Bengal's then owners Shree Cement had terminated the contract with the club.

198.title: Stuck from 3 hrs, no breakfast: SpiceJet flyer as he shares video amid ransomware attack
198.article_body: After SpiceJet said flights are operating normally following an attempted ransomware attack, a passenger refuted its claim. "We're stuck...since 3 hrs and 45 mins? Neither cancelling nor operating, sitting in the flight...No breakfast, no response!" the Twitter user wrote while sharing a video. "Who says the flights have normalised...People waiting from 6 am," another tweet read.

199.title: Helmets to be mandatory for pillion riders in Mumbai from June 9
199.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has made it mandatory for both the rider and pillion rider to wear helmets while riding a two-wheeler. Helmets will be made compulsory for cyclists as well, a circular said, adding the new rule will be implemented after 15 days from now. Violators will be fined ₹500 and their driving licence will be suspended for three months.

200.title: Air patrol with Russia not directed at any country: China
200.article_body: China said the joint aerial patrol conducted with Russia on Tuesday over the Sea of Japan, East China Sea, and Western Pacific wasn't directed at any country. The patrol, first since the Russian invasion of Ukraine, was part of an annual military exercise, China's Defence Ministry said. The exercise took place as leaders of the Quad group met in Tokyo.

201.title: It's not like Kohli isn't scoring runs at all like Rohit: Manjrekar
201.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said Virat Kohli was scoring 30s and half-centuries previously as well, unlike Rohit Sharma who is not scoring runs at all. "Somewhere the fans knew that he wasn't in form yet," added Manjrekar. Rohit scored 268 runs in IPL 2022 which did not include a single half-century. Kohli has scored 309 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

202.title: Reduce VAT on fuel prices: Tamil Nadu BJP chief urges DMK govt
202.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday urged DMK-led state government to reduce VAT on fuel prices. He claimed that the state's VAT is higher than the excise duty imposed by Centre. "[DMK]...assured to reduce ₹5 per litre on petrol and ₹4 per litre for diesel," Annamalai stated, adding that the government failed to fulfil its 2021 poll promise.

203.title: Jamun price soars to ₹280/kg in Navi Mumbai's retail market
203.article_body: The price of jamun or black plum touched ₹280/kg in Navi Mumbai. "Earlier, the fruit was not much in demand. But after citizens got to know its medical benefits, the demand has gone up," a trader said. According to an APMC trader, arrival of jamun is not consistent as they are not grown like other fruits, leading to price rise.

204.title: Not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years: Kapil Sibal on quitting Congress
204.article_body: After revealing he has resigned from Congress party on May 16, former Union Minister Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said, "It's not easy to leave a relationship of 30-31 years." He added, "I'll not say anything about Congress. I've resigned, so it's not appropriate for me to say anything." Sibal filed nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections as an Independent candidate.

205.title: NASA shares InSight lander's last selfie taken on Mars
205.article_body: NASA has shared its InSight Mars lander's final selfie, which the lander took on April 24. In the selfie, the lander is covered with far more dust than it was in its first selfie, taken in 2018. The team will soon put InSight's robotic arm in its resting position (called the "retirement pose") for the last time in May 2022.

206.title: 3 arrested, 4 other juveniles booked for murder attempt in Pune
206.article_body: Pune's Hadapsar Police on Tuesday arrested three individuals and booked four other juveniles for their alleged involvement in an attempted murder case. The accused had allegedly attacked a 19-year-old kiosk owner in the city's Kalepadal area on Sunday. According to the police, the group attacked the victim to avenge the murder of one of their associates last month.

207.title: 1 policeman martyred, 3 terrorists killed in J&K's Baramulla encounter
207.article_body: While three Pakistani terrorists were killed, one Jammu and Kashmir policeman was martyred during an encounter in the Baramulla district, which began on Wednesday morning, police said. Incriminating materials, including arms and ammunition, were also recovered in the operation, Inspector General of Police, Kashmir zone, Vijay Kumar tweeted.

208.title: Crocodile tears: BJP after Kejriwal says Mann's action brought tears
208.article_body: Reacting to AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's "brought tears to my eyes" statement after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann sacked a minister over corruption charges, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said, "These are crocodile tears and the country is ashamed of it." "When your own minister involves in corruption and gets caught for his sin, what is so proud of this?" Bhatia added.

209.title: Got such a character that nobody dared to step near me: Urvashi on Komolika
209.article_body: Talking about her character of Komolika in TV serial 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', actress Urvashi Dholakia said, "I got such a character [that nobody dared to step near me]." "I didn't get any offers...after playing that character," added Urvashi. She stated that producer Ekta Kapoor had told her, the character would make her the next sex bomb of television industry.

210.title: Kohli-backed Digit Insurance targets $5 bn in IPO valuation: Report
210.article_body: Virat Kohli-backed fintech startup Digit Insurance is planning to raise about $500 million in an IPO at a valuation of $4.5 billion to $5 billion, Reuters reported citing sources. It plans to file its draft documents to SEBI by September and list by January. Digit was valued at close to $4 billion earlier this month.

211.title: People in courtroom laugh as Depp's witness denies being his fan, video viral
211.article_body: In a video shared online, people in courtroom can be heard bursting into laughter as Johnny Depp's witness in the ongoing defamation case said that he is not a fan of the actor. In the video, the witness also started to further elaborate his answer, after which, he was stopped and told that he was only asked one question.

212.title: I was in college when I witnessed the pain of north-east people: Ayushmann
212.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said he was in college when he first witnessed "the pain of north-east people". "I must be 19, we had a Manipuri guy who called me 'Mayang' (it means an outsider)," he added. "I asked him why he does so and he told me 'You guys treat us as outsiders, so we'll call you outsiders'," Ayushmann said.

213.title: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's wife, sons skipped multiple summons: ED
213.article_body: Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik’s wife and their two sons skipped multiple summons by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to join the probe in connection with a money laundering case, the ED stated in its charge sheet. Malik's wife was summoned twice while his son, Faraj Malik, was summoned five times in connection with the case, the ED stated.

214.title: Newborn, found alive hour after being buried, dies at Srinagar hospital
214.article_body: A newborn girl, who was found alive an hour after her burial, died at a Srinagar hospital on Wednesday morning, officials said. The baby was initially declared dead after being born, following which her family buried her at graveyard in Banihal. However, after villagers objected to her burial, the family dug up her grave during which she was found alive.

215.title: Indian civil officer counters Rahul Gandhi at Cambridge University; video goes viral
215.article_body: Indian civil service officer Siddhartha Verma countered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at the University of Cambridge, a video of which has now gone viral. Verma tweeted, "I questioned Mr Rahul Gandhi on his statement that 'India is not a nation but a Union of States'. He asserted that India is not a nation but the result of negotiation between states."

216.title: TVF founder Arunabh marries girlfriend Shruti after dating for 10 years, shares pics
216.article_body: The Viral Fever (TVF) founder Arunabh Kumar tied the knot with his girlfriend Shruti Ranjan after dating for 10 years. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Arunabh and Shruti wrote, "We tied the knot of holy matrimony a while back in presence of our immediate family members...We look forward to a journey ahead full of love & light."

217.title: Underage girl can abort without parental consent if raped: Mexico's Supreme Court
217.article_body: Mexico's Supreme Court has ruled that an underage girl can get an abortion without parental consent if she has been raped. The court said it was not necessary to file a crime report about the rape and the victim only has to swear she was raped. Last year, the court held that it was unconstitutional to punish abortion.

218.title: Value of crypto raised by Ukraine falls amid crypto market fall
218.article_body: The value of cryptocurrency raised by Ukraine has fallen amid a drop in cryptocurrencies in recent weeks. On March 19, the "Aid for Ukraine" fund said it had raised cryptocurrency worth over $60 million. Two months later, on May 19, the total value was $51.5 million. Ukraine was able to spend $45 million on its army before the crash.

219.title: 160 liquor vends auctioned in Gurugram east, ₹568 cr collected
219.article_body: The Haryana government auctioned 160 liquor vends in Gurugram east on Tuesday through e-tenders and earned ₹568 crore, said the excise department officials. The reserve price, which is the lowest price at which the department is willing to auction the liquor shop, was kept at ₹432 crore. The highest bid received was ₹35 crore for a shop in Sector 40.

220.title: Yash can't do smaller movies, will only do pan-Indian films: 'KGF' producer
220.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur, who is the producer of actor Yash-starrers 'K.G.F' and 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', said Yash has become a big Indian star, adding that he has set huge targets and has to beat his own targets now. "He's going to do only pan-Indian movies...He has reached that level. So he can't do any smaller movies in future," stated Vijay.

221.title: Police attacked by Nigerian national during drug raid on his cafe in B'luru
221.article_body: A 44-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for allegedly assaulting the police when they raided his cafe to recover drugs in Bengaluru's Chikka Banaswadi on Saturday. According to the police, the accused, Elvis Kayine, attacked them with a liquor bottle, injuring three police constables. The entire act was recorded by one of the persons who helped the police arrest Elvis.

222.title: Man sentenced to 8 yrs in jail for raping 15-yr-old girl in Jammu in 2014
222.article_body: A fast-track court in Jammu sentenced a man to eight years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a 15-year-old girl in 2014. His co-accused was sentenced to four months in jail. According to the prosecution, the girl was returning home when the men forcefully kidnapped her, took her to an unknown place from the Gho Manhasan road and sexually assaulted her.

223.title: 6 tourists from WB killed, 31 injured as bus overturns in Odisha
223.article_body: At least six tourists from West Bengal's Howrah were killed and 31 others were injured when the bus in which they were travelling overturned in Odisha's Kalinga Ghati on Tuesday night, police said. The bus was carrying 76 passengers to Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police added. The bus hit an electric pole before overturning after the driver lost control, police stated.

224.title: Man robbed of gold chain & phone by couple on Pune-Mumbai highway
224.article_body: A man was allegedly robbed of a gold chain worth ₹2 lakh and a cell phone worth ₹19,499 by a couple at knifepoint on the Pune-Mumbai highway on Tuesday. The incident took place when Vishal Pangarkar stopped near a petrol pump on the highway to attend nature's call at around 5 am. Police have launched an investigation into the incident.

225.title: Was asked to give brotherhood message after Babri case: Ghai on 'Pyaar Ki...'
225.article_body: While talking about the song 'Pyaar Ki Ganga Bahe', filmmaker Subhash Ghai said after the Babri Masjid was demolished, he got call from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, asking if film industry can send out a message of brotherhood. "I agreed...The atmosphere in the country was very charged...People were dying in communal clashes and everyone was disturbed," he added.

226.title: Locals hold funeral for monkey after it dies of electrocution in MP
226.article_body: The residents of Teonthar town in Madhya Pradesh on Monday held a traditional funeral for a monkey that died due to electrocution after the civic officials and forest department refused to cremate the animal. A video of the funeral procession with a music band showing a man holding the monkey's carcass with garlands also reportedly went viral on social media.

227.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine may be start of World War III: Soros
227.article_body: Billionaire investor George Soros on Tuesday said the Russian invasion of Ukraine "may have been the beginning of the Third World War and our civilisation may not survive it". "The best and perhaps only way to preserve our civilisation is to defeat [Russian President Vladimir] Putin as soon as possible," he added, while speaking at World Economic Forum in Davos.

228.title: 2 men kill friend in MP for not ensuring early bail in criminal case, held
228.article_body: Two men in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur allegedly killed their friend for not ensuring an early bail in a criminal case. Jaideep Rathore had been imprisoned with two others, police said. While Rathore was released after a year, one of his friends, Siddharth, was annoyed over delay in his release. Siddharth then along with another friend killed Rathore, police added.

229.title: Kapil Sibal resigns from Cong, files Rajya Sabha nomination with Samajwadi Party's support
229.article_body: Senior Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Wednesday filed the nomination for Rajya Sabha in the presence of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav with the party's support at its headquarters in Uttar Pradesh. "I had tendered my resignation from the Congress party on May 16," Sibal said after filing nomination for the Rajya Sabha elections.

230.title: Had forgotten to be fearless: Sonali on lesson learnt post her cancer diagnosis
230.article_body: When asked about the one lesson she learnt after battling cancer, actress Sonali Bendre said she had forgotten to be fearless. She added, "When you turn a parent, you start turning really fearful." "Goldie Behl (husband) and I had this conversation. We promised ourselves that we need to go back to being fearless again," she said.

231.title: Not our culture: Raut on Stalin meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict
231.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin for meeting Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict AG Perarivalan, upon his release, saying, "If CM felicitates his assassins, I think it's not our culture." "Everyone knows Tamil Nadu's politics. Rajiv Gandhi was nation's leader. He sacrificed himself. He was assassinated in Tamil Nadu," Raut added.

232.title: Woman's decomposed, semi-naked body found on vacant farmland in Delhi
232.article_body: A woman's decomposed body was found in a semi-naked condition in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area, police said on Tuesday. This comes after a police control room call was received about a body found lying on vacant farmland near Ghitorni. The deceased, whose identity is yet to be ascertained, was approximately 25 to 35 years of age, police added.

233.title: Apple asks Chinese suppliers to speed up iPhone development: Report
233.article_body: Apple has asked its Chinese suppliers to speed up iPhone development after its schedule for at least one of the new phones got affected due to China's strict COVID-19 lockdowns, Nikkei reported. Earlier, iPhone assembler Pegatron had to suspend operations at its Shanghai and Kunshan plants last month amid lockdowns due to China's zero-COVID policy.

234.title: Instagram down for some users; people unable to login, refresh feed
234.article_body: Meta-owned social media platform Instagram is facing an outage. Multiple users took to Twitter to confirm that Instagram is not working for them. Several users reported feeds not refreshing, while others said they were not able to login to the app. Meta hasn't acknowledged or commented on the outage yet.

235.title: 10 new cases of monkeypox detected in Canada, more expected
235.article_body: Canada has reported 10 new cases of monkeypox, taking the total number of infections to 15 in the country. All the cases were found in the Quebec province. Canadian Health Minister Jean-Yves Duclos said, "We expect more cases to be confirmed in the coming days." He said samples from other parts of the country were being sent for testing.

236.title: Woman's body with stab injuries found in sack in Mumbai, friend held
236.article_body: The body of a woman, reportedly in her mid-twenties, was found in a sack near railway track in Mumbai's Mahim. Police arrested the accused who is reportedly victim's friend. Reports said there was an argument between the two, following which, the friend killed the woman. The woman's throat was slit and there were stab injuries on her body, reports added.

237.title: News sells on Hardik Pandya's name, I don't have any problem: Hardik on his critics
237.article_body: Referring to his critics, GT captain Hardik Pandya, in a press conference, said, "It's people's job to speak. What can I do?" He added, "News sells on Hardik Pandya's name. I don't have any problem. I just laugh it off." Hardik-led GT defeated RR in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1 to reach the final in their first-ever season.

238.title: What I feel is not important: Sachin on Arjun warming the bench for MI for 2 seasons
238.article_body: On being asked whether he would've liked to watch his son Arjun Tendulkar play in an IPL match this year, Sachin Tendulkar said, "What I'm thinking or what I feel isn't important." Sachin added he never involves himself in team selection and leaves it to the team management. Arjun has been with MI since 2021 and is yet to debut.

239.title: 18-yr-old shot his grandmother before killing 19 kids at US school
239.article_body: Salvador Ramos, the 18-year-old gunman, shot his grandmother before he killed 21 people including 19 kids. After shooting her, he fled the scene and crashed his car near the Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas. His grandmother survived after reportedly being airlifted to a hospital.

240.title: Messages sent by 18-yr-old shooter to stranger before killing 19 kids in US surface
240.article_body: The 18-year-old gunman who killed 21 people including 19 kids at a school in US messaged a stranger before the massacre. The stranger shared the messages on Instagram and wrote, "I know nothing about him he decided to tag me in his gun post. I'm so sorry for the victims and their families I really don't know what to say."

241.title: 3 held in Faridabad for using trans people's dating app to extort money
241.article_body: The Faridabad Police arrested three members of a gang, who allegedly blackmailed at least 25 men after befriending them on Grindr and recorded their objectionable videos and extorted money from them. Grindr is a social networking app for gay, bisexual and transgender people. "They created fake accounts on Grindr to connect with victims," a senior police officer said.

242.title: NASA captures eruption of underwater volcano 'Sharkcano'; shares pics
242.article_body: NASA took to Twitter to share pictures of an erupting underwater volcano. "In 2015, scientists found hammerhead sharks living in the hot, acidic waters of Kavachi Volcano's underwater crater. The 'Sharkcano', as they called it, is erupting again," it wrote. Kavachi Volcano in the Solomon Islands is one of the most active submarine volcanoes in the Pacific.

243.title: Dhawan has definitely missed the bus: Ex-chief selector Prasad on T20 WC
243.article_body: Discussing the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Team India chief selector MSK Prasad said batter Shikhar Dhawan has "definitely" missed the bus with regard to selection in Team India's squad for the tournament. "I personally felt that they should have tried him in...[the upcoming T20I series against South Africa]. If they were not happy...they could have gone ahead," added Prasad.

244.title: A batter like Virat Kohli is never out of form: RCB's Mohammed Siraj
244.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj said a batter like Virat Kohli is never out of form, adding that he "always" puts the team first, tries to score as many runs as possible. "Kohli always tells all the youngsters [to] put the country first," stated Siraj. Kohli has scored 309 runs in 14 IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 117.93.

245.title: Zoho invests ₹20 cr in Anand Mahindra-backed startup Genrobotics
245.article_body: Zoho Corporation has invested ₹20 crore in Anand Mahindra-backed robotics startup Genrobotics. Kerala-based Genrobotics builds robotics and AI-based solutions for social issues such as hazardous working conditions. Its primary offering is the Bandicoot robot which is designed to clean confined spaces such as sewers manholes, sewer wells, storm water manholes and oily water sewers.

246.title: 3 dead, several sick after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
246.article_body: Three people died and several others fell sick after allegedly consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's Pathra village. While one of the three deceased was declared brought dead when rushed to the hospital, the remaining two died at hospital and eight are currently under treatment. The family of the deceased alleged that they had consumed liquor during wedding function on Monday.

247.title: UAE becomes first Gulf country to report monkeypox case
247.article_body: The UAE has become the first Gulf country to report a case of monkeypox. The case was found in a 29-year-old woman arriving from West Africa, who's receiving medical treatment, the Ministry of Health and Prevention said. The UAE said it's "fully prepared" to handle any outbreak, adding that early surveillance protocols for detecting the disease were in place.

248.title: Thought I'd become a hero not an actor, glamour attracted me: Kartik
248.article_body: Speaking about the Bollywood industry, actor Kartik Aaryan said people think Bollywood is all about glamour, but it's not true. "Everyone sees...glamour, but people are very focused. When I first thought of becoming an actor, I...thought of becoming a hero and not an actor," he added. "Glamour...attracted me but slowly I came to know that this is art," Kartik said.

249.title: Vijay Singla’s arrest is face-saving exercise for AAP: Punjab Cong chief
249.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja termed Punjab Minister Vijay Singla’s arrest, after he was sacked by CM Bhagwant Mann, as a "face-saving" exercise for AAP. "You can’t get away by just making a symbolic case while letting others go scot-free as Singla was not the only suspect in the pack, there are others as well," Raja added.

250.title: Case filed against policeman for raping woman colleague in Maharashtra
250.article_body: Police on Tuesday filed a case against a constable for allegedly raping and cheating a woman colleague in Maharashtra's Palghar. The accused raped her on several occasions under the pretext of marrying her but did not fulfil the promise, the victim alleged. The case was registered against the accused under the Indian Penal Code Sections 376 (rape) and 420 (cheating).

251.title: Denied ticket, K'taka Cong Gen Secy says party ignoring 50% of population
251.article_body: Karnataka Congress General Secretary Kavitha Reddy criticised her party after being denied ticket in the upcoming Legislative Council elections and said that social justice is irrelevant and incomplete without gender justice. "Why is Congress ignoring 50% of...population? Is there no representation for women in our Assembly, Council, or Parliament at all? Is it no entry for women?" she said.

252.title: 96% of Indians breathe hazardous air, says a study
252.article_body: As many as 1.33 billion people, that is 96% of India’s estimated 1.39 billion people, breathe hazardous air, a recent study by World Bank experts estimated. At least 200 million people in India live in extreme poverty and are exposed to dangerous levels of air pollution, according to the study.

253.title: Crime in Bihar rising rapidly, need to sideline corrupt officers: Speaker
253.article_body: Bihar Legislative Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Tuesday said that the crime graph in Bihar is increasing rapidly. "We have to bring honest officers into the field and sideline the corrupt ones," Sinha added. "We have to curb the mentality of those involved in corruption. Only transferring officials will not help," he stated.

254.title: 30-yr-old farmer mauled to death by tiger in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
254.article_body: A 30-year-old farmer was mauled to death by a tiger near Majhara railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri. Kamlesh Kumar was returning home on his bicycle from a field when the tiger attacked him and tried to drag him into the forest. His friend scared the tiger away with sticks following which it fled leaving behind Kumar fatally injured.

255.title: Places of Worship Act violates principles of secularism: Plea in SC
255.article_body: A fresh plea challenging the Places of Worship Act has been filed in the Supreme Court by a religious leader, Swami Jeetendranand Saraswati, according to ANI. The plea contends that certain sections of the Act violate the principles of secularism and the rule of law. This comes amid the controversy surrounding the Gyanvapi Mosque in Varanasi.

256.title: 2 kids fall through shaft on 9th floor of Greater Noida high-rise, injured
256.article_body: Two children, aged 10 and 12, were injured after they fell into an open shaft from the ninth floor of a high-rise in Greater Noida on Tuesday evening. According to police, the incident took place at Supertech Ecovillage-2 when the boys were playing cricket on the ninth-floor corridor. They suffered injuries on their heads and shoulders, police said.

257.title: Large gatherings banned near K'taka mosque after temple-like structure found under it
257.article_body: Large gatherings have been banned within 500-metre area of Juma Masjid in Malali, on the outskirts of Mangaluru, Karnataka. According to authorities, Section 144 is in place from 8 pm of May 24 to 8 am of May 26. A Hindu temple-like architectural design was discovered underneath the mosque during the renovation work on April 21, ANI reported.

258.title: Iraqi man arrested in US over plan to kill ex-President George W Bush
258.article_body: An Iraqi national living in US' Ohio was arrested on Tuesday for planning to kill former President George W Bush in revenge for Iraq war, the US Justice Department announced. Shihab Ahmed Shihab, 52, told an FBI informant that he wanted to smuggle at least four other Iraqis into the country over the border with Mexico to undertake the plot.

259.title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles hours after US President Biden leaves Asia
259.article_body: North Korea fired ballistic missiles hours after US President Biden departed for the US on Tuesday evening, South Korea's military has said. In a meeting convened after the launch, South Korea's National Security Council called it a "grave provocation". Biden's five-day Asia trip saw him visiting South Korea and Japan.

260.title: Speed gun shows Ashwin's delivery clocked 131.6 kmph against GT, turns out to be a glitch
260.article_body: During the eighth over of GT's innings, the speed gun showed that one of RR's Ravichandran Ashwin's deliveries clocked 131.6 kmph. However, it turned out to be a glitch. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "He wants to win the fastest delivery award." Another user wrote, "Same speed with which Buttler was run out at the non-striker's end by him."

261.title: D*** move: Musk on Gates allegedly funding organisations against him
261.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to an article saying billionaire Bill Gates' foundation funded anti-Musk organisations, said, "What a d*** move!" The article claimed that 11 anti-Musk organisations have received funding from a Gates-backed entity. Earlier this month, Gates had said Musk could make Twitter "worse" but added that people should have an open mind and "never underestimate Elon".

262.title: Kejriwal asks officials to fix issues of Kashmiri Pandits at INA
262.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked officers to resolve issues of Kashmiri Pandits whose shops were shifted to INA market. The Pandits complained that they haven't received electricity connections so far and sought compensation they were promised for shifting shops. Kejriwal ordered installation of a transformer at the site if there is not one already.

263.title: Gauri, Manish attend Karan's b'day party; designer shares glimpse of decor
263.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar turned 50 on Wednesday. His close friend, fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a glimpse of the decoration at his birthday party. The video showed long tables placed in a line with white flowers and candles on them. Most of his close friends including Gauri Khan, Farah Khan, Seema Khan and Maheep Kapoor also attended the party.

264.title: Germany orders 40,000 vaccine doses as precaution against monkeypox
264.article_body: Germany has ordered 40,000 doses of a Bavarian Nordic vaccine to be ready to vaccinate contacts of those infected with monkeypox if an outbreak in the country becomes more severe. However, German Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said that for now, measures such as at least a 21-day isolation period recommended for infected people would be enough to contain the outbreak.

265.title: Blessed that I am her man, never ceases to amaze me: Ranveer on Deepika
265.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he is truly lucky and blessed to be married to actress Deepika Padukone, adding that she is doing things that are "unprecedented" for any man or woman in Indian entertainment. "The more I get to know her, the more I fall in love with her," stated Ranveer. "She never ceases to amaze me," he said.

266.title: Spicejet systems face attempted ransomware attack; flight departures affected
266.article_body: Spicejet on Wednesday tweeted, "Certain SpiceJet systems faced an attempted ransomware attack last night that impacted and slowed down morning flight departures today." "Our IT team has contained and rectified the situation and flights are operating normally now," the airline said. Several passengers tweeted they were stuck and there was no communication from the airline.

267.title: Bail plea of filmmaker Avinash Das who shared old pic of Amit Shah rejected
267.article_body: Bombay HC has rejected filmmaker Avinash Das' transit pre-arrest bail plea for tweeting a photo of Union Home Minister Amit Shah in which he was seen with Jharkhand cadre IAS officer Pooja Singhal at a public event five years ago. Das was booked by the Gujarat Police. Singhal was recently arrested by ED in connection with a money laundering case.

268.title: People who've nothing concrete in life become godmen: Director Prakash Jha
268.article_body: Director Prakash Jha said he feels that people who have nothing concrete in life become godmen and preach spirituality to gain attention. "Overall, all the godmen are similar," added Jha. Discussing the character of 'Baba Nirala' in his web series 'Aashram', Jha jokingly stated that "no one" would be a bigger 'Baba Nirala' in Bollywood than him.

269.title: Haven't got monkeypox samples, they're expected soon: NIV Director in Pune
269.article_body: Director of Pune-based National Institute of Virology (NIV), Dr Priya Abraham, said no samples for monkeypox have been received as of now. "However, we expect to receive them soon," she added. Public health authorities have been directed to monitor people with unexplained rash, especially those who have travelled in last 21 days to countries with confirmed or suspected monkeypox cases.

270.title: Salman told Aayush to leave 'Kabhi Eid..' after creative differences: Report
270.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, who is also the producer of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' told actor Aayush Sharma that it would be best to leave if his creative differences with the film's director can't be resolved, reports said. Reports also added that actor Abhimanyu Dassani will be replacing Sharma in the film and actress Shehnaaz Gill will be seen opposite him.

271.title: Delhi government opens centre for oral health, tobacco cessation
271.article_body: Delhi government on Tuesday opened the National Resource Centre for Oral Health and Tobacco Cessation to spread awareness about side effects of tobacco and drug use. Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain, while inaugurating the centre, said proper awareness was among reasons behind rapid rise of oral cancer cases. The centre will also provide training to dentists from across the country.

272.title: What will happen to childbirth if a man gets married to another man?: Bihar CM on dowry
272.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that taking dowry for marriage is a "useless thing". He added, "Children will be born only if you will get married. What will happen to childbirth if a man gets married to another man?" The Chief Minister made these remarks while inaugurating a girls' hostel in Patna on Monday.

273.title: BJP leader hacked to death over 'previous enmity' in Chennai
273.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP Central District Chairman of the SC/ST wing, Balachander, was allegedly murdered by three unidentified assailants in Chennai, police said. "It's a murder case involving a previous enmity...Eyewitnesses have spoken about the incident," police added. Reportedly, Balachander was provided with a personal security officer and was killed when the officer went for a tea break.

274.title: Mumbai records 8,768 road accidents in 2022, highest in Maharashtra
274.article_body: Mumbai reported more than 45% of road accidents that occurred in Maharashtra during January to April period this year. Out of the total 19,383 accidents reported in the state, 8,768 accidents took place in Mumbai, which is the highest in the state. The number of accidents in Mumbai is high because of the ongoing project works, a transport official said.

275.title: J&K LG Manoj Sinha visits Umran Malik's house to congratulate him for India call-up
275.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu & Kashmir, Manoj Sinha, visited pacer Umran Malik's residence to congratulate him for his maiden Team India call-up. He said, "J&K government will take care of his training and provide all necessary facilities. There is already a provision in the sports policy that a government job will be given to him whenever he wishes to join."

276.title: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta marries partner of 17 years Safeena Husain; shares pics
276.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta has tied the knot with partner Safeena Husain. While sharing pictures, he wrote, "So after 17 years, two children, watching our sons growing up and chasing our respective dreams we decided to get hitched. As always...this was...unplanned." "Our vows however were truthful and but for this little ceremony they would never have been said," Mehta said.

277.title: India reports 2,124 new COVID-19 cases, 17 deaths in last 24 hours
277.article_body: India has reported 2,124 COVID-19 cases, 1,977 recoveries and 17 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 1,675 COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,971, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,507.

278.title: It's a mistake: US on UN human rights chief's visit to China
278.article_body: The US called UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet's visit to China a "mistake". During her six-day trip, Bachelet will visit the Xinjiang region. "We've no expectation China will grant the necessary access required to conduct...unmanipulated assessment of the human rights environment in Xinjiang," the US said, adding Bachelet wouldn't be able to obtain a picture "of....genocide" in the region.

279.title: Was called an outsider by a Manipuri guy when I was 19: Ayushmann
279.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said he felt the pain experienced by people from Northeast India for the first time when he was 19, after being called an outsider. "I asked him why he does so and he [said], 'You guys treat us as outsiders, so we will call you outsiders'," added Ayushmann. Ayushmann's upcoming film 'Anek' is based in Northeast India.

280.title: Delhi to be transformed into city of lakes: Environment Minister
280.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Tuesday said that the national capital will be transformed into a city of lakes. "The Wetland Authority of Delhi has...finished...mapping of roughly 1,018 lakes [for the project]," Rai said. In the first phase, 20 lakes in Delhi including, Sanjay Lake, Hauz Khas Lake, Najafgarh Lake etc will be revamped and beautified, Rai added.

281.title: Man held for vandalising idols in Greater Noida temple
281.article_body: GB Nagar Police arrested a 27-year-old man for vandalising idols at a temple in Sector 37, Greater Noida. Three idols in the temple were found broken by a resident. The suspect told police that he vandalised idols because he was "furious at God for not listening to his prayers" as a family member recently passed away due to illness.

282.title: Bharat Bandh on May 25 over demand of caste-based census
282.article_body: The All India Backward And Minority Communities Employees Federation (BAMCEF) has called for a Bharat Bandh on May 25. It has been called for as the Central government is not conducting a caste-based census for the Other Backward Classes (OBC). BAMCEF is also protesting against the use of EVMs in elections and reservations for the SC/ST/OBC in the private sector.

283.title: Fawad was tough on me, it was difficult: Zindagi Gulzar Hai actor Sheheryar
283.article_body: Sheheryar Munawar Siddiqui opened up about his experience of working in the Pakistani drama, 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai'. Speaking about working with Fawad Khan on the sets of the show, Sheheryar said, "He gave me quite a tough time." "Now that I think of it...the fear of being there on set, it was quite a difficult time for me," he added.

284.title: Remove Savarkar's portrait from Hyd museum: T'gana Cong urges state govt
284.article_body: Telangana Congress on Wednesday urged the state government to remove Veer Savarkar's portrait from Hyderabad's Salar Jung museum. It urged the government to replace it with portraits of freedom fighters like Mahatma Gandhi, Bhagat Singh or Nizams of Hyderabad. "The Nizam family...donated several antique pieces. However...government didn't acknowledge it," said Congress leader Osman Mohammed Khan.

285.title: Patiala Jail authorities told to give diet recommended by doctors to Sidhu
285.article_body: The Patiala Central Jail has been directed by a court to provide the diet recommended by the board of doctors to Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who has been sentenced to one year jail in a 1988 road rage case. The board, which conducted the examination on Monday, has advised a low-carbohydrate, low-fat and a high-fibre diet for Sidhu.

286.title: Senior SAD leader Tota Singh cremated with full state honours in Punjab
286.article_body: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader and Punjab's former agriculture and education minister Tota Singh was cremated with full state honours in Moga on Tuesday. His son, SAD leader Barjinder Singh Brar lit the pyre amid a guard of honour by the police. Singh passed away aged 81 on Saturday at a private hospital in Mohali after a prolonged illness.

287.title: SpiceJet faces attempted ransomware attack, flights see delays
287.article_body: SpiceJet faced an attempted ransomware attack on Tuesday night which impacted and slowed down its morning flight departures today. "Our IT team has contained and rectified the situation and flights are operating normally now," the airline wrote on Twitter. The attack comes days after SpiceJet said it's hoping to start a broadband internet service onboard its planes soon.

288.title: Man found with skull of friend he killed 8 months ago in MP, held
288.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Shamsher, and his live-in-partner, Asha Thakur, have been arrested for killing Shamsher's friend and keeping his skull at home, eight months after the murder. Reports said that the incident came to light when they threatened their neighbours with the skull during an argument. The two had killed the man after Asha told Shamsher he was harassing her.

289.title: Headmasters show-caused after 2 BBMP schools score 0% in SSLC
289.article_body: Two Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) schools scored zero percent result in SSLC exams as 21 students from the schools, who appeared for the exam, failed. The BBMP issued a show-cause notice to the headmasters of both the schools and has also terminated services of teachers. The BBMP has also marked schools which have recorded pass percentage less than 50%.

290.title: 21 killed, many wounded in police shootout in Rio de Janeiro
290.article_body: At least 21 people were reportedly killed and seven injured in a police operation in Rio de Janeiro's Vila Cruzeiro favela on Tuesday. According to police, the raid was aimed at finding and arresting criminal leaders. Initially, the police said one resident was killed and 11 were wounded, but later on, several victims taken to the hospital were found dead.

291.title: India’s first mattress that keeps you 4° cooler: SleepyCat Ultima
291.article_body: SleepyCat has launched the new Ultima Mattress with Vir Das as the face of the campaign. It is India's first mattress with CoolTEC™ Fabric that lets you sleep 4° cooler, thanks to the fabric's ability to draw heat away from the body, stated the company. The mattress also provides 7-zone full body contoured support, through its DeepTouch™ Pressure Technology.

292.title: Mumbai man thrown off bridge in Vasai creek over affair, one held
292.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly throwing a 20-year-old man from a bridge into Vasai creek as the latter was having an affair with his relative. The deceased, Deepak Katukar, was having an affair with a 19-year-old woman. As per Deepak's mother, the woman's parents did not like the relationship and had also lodged complaint against him.

293.title: Russian court upholds Navalny's 9-yr jail sentence for fraud
293.article_body: A Russian court rejected Opposition leader Alexei Navalny's plea against the nine-year prison sentence he had received for fraud. He would be moved from a penal colony to a high-security prison. He was found guilty of fraud, embezzlement and contempt of court. He is said to have defrauded his supporters by seeking donations to contest the presidential election.

294.title: 18-yr-old shooter posted pic of 2 rifles on Instagram before killing 19 children in US
294.article_body: The 18-year-old suspected shooter who shot and killed 19 school children and two adults at a Texas elementary school posted a photo of two AR15-style rifles on Instagram before Tuesday's massacre. Multiple classmates confirmed that the account belonged to Salvador Ramos, who was shot dead by officers responding to the school shooting. Authorities said the suspect acted alone.

295.title: Riyan Parag gives 'death stare' to Ashwin in anger after getting run out, video viral
295.article_body: RR batting all-rounder Riyan Parag gave a 'death stare' to Ravichandran Ashwin in anger after getting run out against GT in Qualifier 1 of IPL 2022 on Tuesday. Parag ran towards the striker's end after GT pacer Yash Dayal bowled a wide, while Ashwin did not move. Parag was seen gesturing to Ashwin, seemingly asking why he did not run.

296.title: Miller apologises to his former team RR after GT reach IPL final, RR react with a GIF
296.article_body: GT batter David Miller apologised to his former team RR after his team GT defeated them in Qualifier 1 to reach IPL 2022 final. "Sorry #RoyalsFamily," Miller tweeted. RR reacted with a GIF from 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', which read, "Dushman na kare dost ne wo kaam kiya hai. (Even an enemy won't do what a friend has done)."

297.title: US ride-hailing platform Lyft to slow hiring, no layoffs planned
297.article_body: US-based ride-hailing platform Lyft will be slowing down hiring and assessing budget cuts in some departments. Lyft said no employee layoffs are planned and added it would grant special stock options to eligible employees. Lyft shares have fallen more than 60% this year. "We're also being responsible about costs and will significantly slow hiring," the company said.

298.title: India imposes restrictions on sugar exports from June 1
298.article_body: Centre has imposed restrictions on sugar exports from June 1, Directorate General of Foreign Trade said. "To maintain domestic availability and price stability of sugar in the country during sugar season 2021-22 (October-September), central government to regulate sugar exports wef June 1, till further orders. Government will allow sugar exports up to 100 LMT," Ministry of Consumer Affairs said.

299.title: Wherever AAP goes, it takes corruption with it: BJP spokesperson
299.article_body: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said it is only AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal who can give a "100% corruption rate". "The people of Punjab and the country are saying that wherever this party goes, it takes corruption with itself," Bhatia added.

300.title: My career has my mother's name attached, cannot tarnish it: Palak on Shweta
300.article_body: Talking about actress Shweta Tiwari, actress Palak Tiwari said, "I'm not only building this career in my name, it has my mother's name attached to it. Every step I take...[is] also impacting my mother's name." "I may get more opportunities because of my mother, but I need to...think, is this opportunity benefiting me or am I tarnishing my mother's name?"

301.title: 22-year-old man dies after bike hits speed breaker in Pune's Baner
301.article_body: A 22-year-old man in Pune who met with a road accident earlier this month has died while undergoing treatment, police said. Hazrat Ali Islam Shaikh met with an accident on May 3 after the bike he was riding hit a speed breaker near Kapil Malhar society in Baner. The Chaturshringi Police have lodged a case of accidental death.

302.title: Elon Musk's net worth drops below $200 billion again as Tesla share price tumbles
302.article_body: Elon Musk has again fallen out of the $200 billion club, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk, the world's richest person, saw his fortune drop by 5.4% to $192.7 billion on Tuesday as shares of Tesla Inc slid almost 7%. Musk last dipped below the $200 billion threshold in March.

303.title: India’s 1st manned space mission will be launched in 2023: Jitendra Singh
303.article_body: Union MoS (I/C) for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh said that India's first manned space mission will be launched in 2023, which will be followed by other space missions. "India is...leading nation as far as application of space technology is concerned," he said. "No other country...has such...diverse application of space technology in development and infrastructure programmes," he added.

304.title: 39 killed in 1 day in rain-related incidents in UP, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
304.article_body: As many as 39 people were killed in one day in rain-related incidents in Uttar Pradesh, the state government said on Tuesday. Four people each died due to drowning in Agra and Varanasi, and five people died due to lightning in Aligarh, Shahjahanpur, Banda and Lakhimpur Kheri. CM announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each for the families of deceased.

305.title: Waymap app to help blind people use Washington subway system
305.article_body: Waymap app which helps blind people use public transit will now help them use Washington subway system. It'll be deployed in phases with the goal of deploying it at up to 30 Metro train stations by September and across the entire Metro system by early 2023. The app does not use GPS and can operate regardless of cellphone signal strength.

306.title: Mumbai's BEST fleet to get 525 AC electric buses by December
306.article_body: Mumbai's Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) fleet is expected to get 525 AC electric buses by December this year. These will be part of a deal signed with Olectra Greentech Limited, a Hyderabad-based electric vehicle company, to deliver 2,100 electric buses over a period of 12 months. Notably, BEST is planning to have almost 100% electric fleet by 2027.

307.title: I do my work & disappear, doesn't mean I'm not around: Abhay Deol
307.article_body: When asked why he's picky when it comes to films, actor Abhay Deol said, "I've been around for 17 years. I've...done two films a year. So, that doesn't mean I'm not around." "I do my work and disappear...I'm in a system that has a light constantly shining on a star...but I chose to switch that light off," he added.

308.title: Hyderabad Police busts online cricket betting racket, arrests 3 people
308.article_body: Hyderabad Police has busted an online cricket betting racket within the limits of Kachiguda Police Station and arrested three people. Police recovered ₹25 lakh in cash, 11 line phones, six unused cell phones and five personal mobile phones from the accused. All of the accused are natives of Hyderabad and two were previously arrested in cricket betting cases, police said.

309.title: Most of house stuff bought by Gauri, you're not allowed to disrupt design: SRK
309.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that most of the stuff for his house is bought by his wife Gauri Khan. "You are not allowed to disrupt the design in the house because she is a wonderful designer," he said, adding that he understands technology best in the house. He also said that the aesthetics of his house are amazing.

310.title: Gujarat polls to be one-sided, don't see Congress anywhere: Hardik
310.article_body: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel, who quit the party days ago, said that the upcoming elections in Gujarat will be "one-sided" in BJP's favour. He added, "I don't see Congress anywhere." When asked if he was considering BJP as an option, Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" Patel further said that AAP has a better electoral strategy than Congress.

311.title: Spinner Maya's unusual bowling action in Women's T20 Challenge goes viral
311.article_body: Velocity spinner Maya Sonawane's unusual bowling action during her team's match against Supernovas in Women's T20 Challenge has gone viral on social media. "My neck is hurting by just looking at Maya Sonawane bowl," a fan commented. Several fans compared her action to the action of Paul Adams. "Proper frog in a blender stuff," wrote another user.

312.title: When in God's name will we stand up to gun lobby?: Biden after 19 children shot dead in US
312.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday tweeted, "As a nation we must ask: When in God's name will we stand up to the gun lobby?" He added, "It's time to turn this pain into action." This comes after an 18-year-old gunman killed at least 19 children and two adults after storming into an elementary school in US' Texas.

313.title: WeWork's Adam Neumann's climate tech firm Flowcarbon raises $70 mn
313.article_body: Blockchain-enabled carbon credit trading platform Flowcarbon, co-founded by WeWork Founder Adam Neumann, has raised $70 million. The company sells carbon credits and keeps a record of the transactions on the blockchain. The firm raised $32 million in the funding round led by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz. The balance was raised through the sale of a token.

314.title: IMD predicts light rain and cloudy skies in Mumbai this week
314.article_body: The IMD has predicted more light rain for Mumbai this week. According to the 48 hours forecast, generally cloudy sky with the possibility of light rain or drizzle is likely in Mumbai. Further, the city is expected to record its first pre-monsoon showers in the coming week, with rain and thunderstorms predicted on May 28 and 29, IMD stated.

315.title: 16-yr-old boy forcibly converted, married to mother of 2 in UP
315.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in UP's Kanpur was allegedly forced to convert to Islam and marry a woman who was divorced two years ago and has two children. The boy's family came to know about the incident after they watched it on a video. Bajrang Dal and VHP approached the police after which four people, including the woman, were arrested.

316.title: 5 injured as under-construction stormwater drain collapses in B'luru
316.article_body: A stormwater drain collapsed near Kalidasa Circle in Bengaluru's Srinagar, injuring five workers. Of the five, a 24-year-old worker was severely injured, while the remaining four sustained minor injuries. The incident occurred when the workers were pouring a concrete slab to cover the drain. Local residents alleged the negligence of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike caused the incident.

317.title: Beg India to reconsider wheat export ban: IMF chief Kristalina
317.article_body: Talking about India's wheat export ban, International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said, "I do have an appreciation for the fact that India needs to feed nearly 1.35 billion people...but I would beg India to reconsider as soon as possible." "The more countries step into export restrictions, the more others would be tempted to do so," she told NDTV.

318.title: India calls for reversal of Taliban's 'cover faces in public' policy for Afghan women
318.article_body: India called for reversal of Taliban's "cover faces in public" policy for Afghanistan women following UN Security Council's statement on "increasing erosion of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms of women and girls in the country." Ambassador of India to United Nations TS Tirumurti tweeted, "Deep concern on Taliban announcement that women should cover faces in public."

319.title: Implement order to pay equal wages to nurses: HC to Delhi govt
319.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to implement an earlier court order regarding the wages of nurses in private hospitals. HC was hearing a plea claiming that the Delhi government has not enforced the circular ordering private hospitals to give salaries and allowances to its nurses, at par or close to those given to nurses in government hospitals.

320.title: 18-year-old gunman kills 19 children, 2 adults in mass shooting in a school in US
320.article_body: An 18-year-old gunman killed at least 19 children and two adults after storming into an elementary school in US' Texas. The gunman, who was later killed by police, had reportedly also shot his grandmother before opening fire at the Robb Elementary School in Uvalde. Authorities said the suspect was armed with a handgun, an AR-15 semi-automatic rifle and high-capacity magazines.

321.title: Unified MCD officials' postings to be completed in 15 days: Officials
321.article_body: The posting of employees in different wings of the unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is likely to be completed in 15 days, officials said on Tuesday. Constant departmental meetings are being held to expedite the reshuffling and shape MCD's structure, the officials added. Meetings to explore possible solutions to strengthen the MCD's financial condition are also being held regularly.

322.title: Delhi govt extends validity of retail liquor licences by 2 months
322.article_body: Delhi government has extended the validity of existing licences of retail liquor vends till July 31 over a potential delay in approval of Excise Policy 2022-23, an excise department order stated. The policy has not yet gotten Delhi Lieutenant Governor's approval. Retail liquor vends will have to pay the licence fee for the extended period, the order further stated.

323.title: Miller smashes 3 sixes in a row in last over as GT defeat RR to reach IPL 2022 final
323.article_body: GT defeated RR by seven wickets in Qualifier 1 to reach IPL 2022 final in their first-ever season. David Miller smashed three sixes in a row in last over as GT chased down 189-run target in 19.3 overs to win the match. RR will now face the winner of the Eliminator between RCB and LSG in Qualifier 2 on Friday.

324.title: Can alter output target: Tata Steel CEO on 15% export tax on steel
324.article_body: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran told Reuters that if the 15% export tax on some steel products remains in place for a long time, the company might have to review its production targets. "You will only build as much capacity as you need for the domestic market," Narendran stated. He added that in the medium-to-long term, India should "encourage" exports.

325.title: No need to panic about monkeypox: TN govt's appeal to people
325.article_body:
Tamil Nadu Minister for Health and Family Welfare Ma Subramanian said that no case of monkeypox has been reported in the state and urged people not to panic about the disease. 
"We have directed authorities to step up surveillance at all the airports including screening of passengers who arrive from African countries," the minister said.

326.title: Ashwin is having best IPL season of his life: Nikhil Chopra
326.article_body: Nikhil Chopra praised Ravichandran Ashwin for his performance in ongoing IPL, saying the RR spinner is having best season of his life with his contribution in both departments (batting and bowling). He added, "With many variations up his sleeve, he should be called a mystery spinner. In terms of batting...he has learned the skill to hit big shots in...death overs."

327.title: Tesla loses bid to move sexual harassment suit to arbitration in US
327.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla's bid to send a lawsuit alleging widespread sexual harassment at the company's California plant to private arbitration. As per plaintiff Jessica Barraza, workers and supervisors at the plant routinely made lewd comments and gestures to female employees and Tesla failed to address complaints. At least six similar cases are pending in California state court.

328.title: Shell causing 'extreme harm' to planet: UK consultant as she quits
328.article_body: Caroline Dennett, a UK-based safety consultant for Shell for 11 years, quit publicly while accusing the company of causing "extreme harm" to the planet. "I can no longer work for a company that ignores all...the risks of climate change," Dennett wrote on LinkedIn. She added, "Contrary to Shell's public expressions around net zero, they're...planning to explore and extract much more."

329.title: 3 civilians hurt as terrorists hurl grenades at security forces in J&K
329.article_body: Three civilians were injured on Tuesday after terrorists hurled grenades at a naka party of police and CRPF in the Yaripora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam. As per reports, the terrorists missed the target and the grenades exploded away from the police personnel. The injured have been shifted to a hospital, where their condition is said to be stable.

330.title: Won't allow illegal entry of migrants by land or sea: Greece
330.article_body: Greek Civil Protection Minister Takis Theodorikakos said that Greece wouldn't allow the illegal entry of migrants by land or by sea. The announcement comes after Greece witnessed a rise in attempted entries at the border from Turkey's coast over the past few days. Notably, Greece and Turkey have long been at odds over the issue of illegal entry of migrants.

331.title: $200 billion wiped off social media firms' market value after Snap's profit warning
331.article_body: Social media companies lost about $200 billion in market value on Tuesday after Snap's shares crashed over 40%. The sector-wide selloff was triggered after Snapchat's parent company said it is expecting to miss quarterly revenue and profit targets and will have to slow hiring. Shares of Meta Platforms, Pinterest, Twitter and Google-parent Alphabet were all down between 7% and 24%.

332.title: Male anchors in Afghanistan wear masks after Taliban orders female anchors to cover faces
332.article_body: Male news anchors in Afghanistan have launched a campaign on social media, days after the Taliban issued a decree ordering their female colleagues to cover their faces at work. As part of the campaign, the male anchors are seen donning a face mask during broadcast. They are also sharing photos of themselves with a hashtag reading #FreeHerFace.

333.title: Playing for India is everyone's dream: Bishnoi on being selected for SA T20Is
333.article_body: Spinner Ravi Bishnoi, who was selected in India's 18-member squad for five-match T20I series against South Africa, said, "I'm very excited because it's a good opportunity for me as playing for India is everyone's dream." The first T20I will be played on June 9. Bishnoi had made his India debut in first T20I against West Indies in February this year.

334.title: Medical trainee charred to death in ambulance in UP's Bulandshahr
334.article_body: A 26-year-old medical trainee was charred to death after a 102 ambulance he was driving caught fire in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district on Monday, an official said. The ambulance was on its way to pick up a pregnant woman from a village in the district. The victim was driving the vehicle since its driver was not available at that time.

335.title: Not 100% sure: Osaka on Wimbledon participation after ranking points sanction
335.article_body: Following ATP and WTA's decision to strip Wimbledon of ranking points after they excluded Russian and Belarusian players because of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Naomi Osaka said, "I'm not 100% sure if I'm going to go there." The four-time Grand Slam champion added, "I would say the decision is kind of affecting, like, my mentality going into grass."

336.title: Jewellery worth ₹15 lakh, cash stolen from a shop in Lucknow
336.article_body: Police said that a gang of thieves broke into a jewellery shop in Lucknow's Sarojininagar and stole ornaments worth over ₹15 lakh along with some cash. The incident took place at around 2 am on Tuesday, they said. The shop owner informed the police that 8.6 kg of silver jewellery, 215 grams of gold jewellery and ₹18,000 cash was stolen.

337.title: Nurses protest against privatising hiring process in Maharashtra
337.article_body: Nurses and nursing students across Maharashtra have started protests and have threatened to go on an indefinite strike from Saturday against privatising hiring process. A government resolution issued in April stated that 1,769 of 4,500 vacant posts under DMER could be filled by outsourcing the hiring to an external agency. Nurses are demanding that the government scrap this order.

338.title: Woman shouts at Johnny Depp 'This baby is yours' in courtroom, gets removed
338.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial, a woman with a baby called out to Johnny that the child was his and was removed from the spectator gallery. She yelled that they were soul mates and asked him when he was going to acknowledge he was the father. The woman later claimed she was doing it as a joke.

339.title: Battles in eastern Ukraine could decide country's fate: Official
339.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Ministry spokesperson Oleksandr Motuzyanyk on Tuesday claimed that battles being fought in eastern Ukraine could determine the country's fate. "The situation on the (eastern) front is extremely difficult," he said. "Now we are observing the most active phase of the full-scale aggression which Russia unfolded against our country," Motuzyanyk added.

340.title: More BJP leaders waiting to join TMC: Arjun Singh after quitting BJP
340.article_body: Ex-West Bengal BJP's Vice-President Arjun Singh, who recently joined the TMC after quitting the BJP, on Tuesday claimed that more BJP leaders are waiting to join TMC. "Just wait and see what happens," he said. Reacting to his claims, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that TMC leaders are trying to create an atmosphere of mistrust in BJP's West Bengal unit.

341.title: Bengal man jailed in Nepal for carrying printouts of US currency
341.article_body: A 24-year-old photographer from West Bengal's Salkia has been imprisoned in Nepal since November last year for allegedly carrying printouts of US currency. The man, Durlav Roy Chowdhury, who stated that he needed printouts for a film shoot, further claimed that he was subjected to torture in prison. He's awaiting hearing of his case which will be held on Wednesday.

342.title: IPL 2022 title more important than the purple cap: RR's Chahal
342.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said helping his side win IPL 2022 title is more important than winning the purple cap. Chahal is currently the leading-wicket taker in tournament with 26 wickets so far, just two wickets more than Wanindu Hasaranga. "Never thought much about the purple cap, plan was always to finish in...top two...happy to get that," he added.

343.title: ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for families of Hubli accident victims: PM Modi
343.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each to the families of those who died in the collision between a passenger bus and a lorry in Karnataka's Hubli. "My thoughts are with the bereaved families. May the injured recover soon," PMO tweeted. "The injured would be given ₹50,000," another tweet by the PMO said.

344.title: 14 children aged 12-16 rescued from bangle-making unit in Jaipur
344.article_body: In a joint operation by the Bachpan Bachao Andolan activists, anti-human trafficking unit and local police, 14 children were rescued from a bangle-making unit in Jaipur's Bhatta Basti locality. Police said that all rescued children were between the ages 12 and 16 and were allegedly trafficked from various districts of Bihar. An FIR has been registered against the unit owners.

345.title: Export duty hike on iron ore to ensure steel supply for domestic use: Govt
345.article_body: Steel Secretary Sanjay Singh on Tuesday defended the government's move to increase export duty by 50% on iron ore and 15% on some steel intermediaries. Singh said the decision was taken to ensure that "domestically we can consume more than we produce". He added that the raw material problem was addressed by waiving import duty on coking coal and ferronickel.

346.title: 15-yr-old UP boy sentenced to service at cow shelter for hate post on CM
346.article_body: A Juvenile Justice Board in Uttar Pradesh has ordered a 15-year-old boy to perform community service at two public places. He has been ordered to serve at a cow shelter for 15 days and clean another public place for another 15 days. The boy had shared an objectionable post against CM Yogi Adityanath on social media a month ago.

347.title: 20 countries to provide fresh military aid to Ukraine: US
347.article_body: Twenty countries have pledged to provide fresh military aid to Ukraine to help it fight against Russia, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin announced on Monday. "Many countries are donating critically needed artillery ammunition, coastal defence systems and tanks," he said. The announcement was made after a meeting of 44 countries that are part of Ukraine Defense Contact Group.

348.title: China & Russia hold 1st joint military exercise since Ukraine war
348.article_body: China and Russia's air forces conducted their first joint aerial exercise over Sea of Japan, East China Sea and the Western Pacific, China's defence ministry said. The patrol, the first one since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, is part of annual military exercise, ministry added. Notably, Japan expressed concerns over Russian and Chinese fighter jets' presence near its airspace today.

349.title: Many AAP MLAs are in jail: Khattar on Punjab Minister's removal
349.article_body: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar criticised AAP, saying many of its leaders are in jail and many are removed under corruption charges. "The kind of party it is, nothing can be said...We have a stand-up policy, making people independent. They have a sit-down policy, giving freebies," he said.

350.title: BJP did nothing for Kashmiri Pandits' welfare: Mehbooba Mufti
350.article_body: Accusing BJP of exploiting the situation of Kashmiri Pandits, PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said BJP has done nothing for their welfare. She said Kashmiri Pandits were moved from tents to flats when Manmohan Singh was the PM.
