"When the situation was bad in 2016, we gave the Kashmiri Pandits salaries for 17 months while they were staying home," Mufti said.

351.title: SAIL posts its highest-ever revenue of ₹1.03 lakh crore in FY22
351.article_body: Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) posted its all-time high revenue from operations of ₹1.03 lakh crore in the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022, the company said in a statement. It added that during FY22, SAIL clocked in its best-ever performance in production and sales. The company's profit after tax stood at ₹12,015 crore during the fiscal, it added.

352.title: Don't offer unserviceable flight seats for sale to passengers: DGCA warns airlines
352.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has warned all the airlines against offering unserviceable seats to flyers on their domestic and international flights. "This practice is not only causing inconvenience to the travellers but also inviting a serious safety concern," the regulator asserted. A Delhi-London Air India flight was reportedly delayed after passengers complained about seat quality.

353.title: Google brings feature that shows how a place has changed to Maps app
353.article_body: Street View historical imagery, which allows users to see how a place has changed over the years, is being extended to Google Maps' iOS and Android apps, the company announced on Tuesday. The feature was only available on desktop version of Google Maps until now. As per Google, users can view imagery from as far back as 2007.

354.title: Audience is to blame for regressive content on TV: Actress Hina Khan
354.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, speaking about regressive TV shows, said, "I don't think the content which is made on television, for that you can blame the makers...it's the audience." Hina added that people do not watch progressive television shows. Hina said that nothing will change unless there's a change in attitude. "It'll take another 50 years [to change]," she concluded.

355.title: Cong forms task force for LS polls, adds strategist Sunil Kanugolu
355.article_body: Congress has constituted 'Task Force 2024' ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and roped in political strategist Sunil Kanugolu as a member. Senior party leaders including P Chidambaram, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala are also members of this task force. Notably, this comes weeks after political strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party.

356.title: Idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go: Unilever CEO
356.article_body: Unilever CEO Alan Jope said the idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go. Speaking at a panel discussion at the World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos, Jope said, "Our sustainable brands...are growing much faster than the rest of our portfolio." Unilever's customers, particularly young people, are making brand choices based on social and environmental impact, he added.

357.title: Govt allows duty free import of crude soyabean, sunflower oils for 2 years
357.article_body: The Central government has allowed duty free import of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil for a period of two years. A quantity of 20 lakh metric tonne of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil each per year will incur a 'NIL' rate of customs duty and agricultural infrastructure and development cess, effective May 25, the government said.

358.title: Nepal inaugurates new school funded by Indian grant assistance
358.article_body: An Indian embassy official inaugurated a new school in Nepal's Pokhara on Tuesday, which has been funded by grants from India. The project, with an estimated cost of NPR 36.30 million (₹2.2 crore), is one of the 75 projects funded by India which are being inaugurated in Nepal this year. The school has been categorised as High-Impact Community Development Project.

359.title: Snap's shares crash 41% in their biggest-ever intraday decline
359.article_body: Shares of Snapchat's parent company Snap crashed over 41% on Tuesday, marking their biggest intraday decline ever since the company went public in 2017. The company's share price dipped below its initial public offering (IPO) price to as low as $13.55. Snap's stock crashed after the company cut its revenue and profit forecasts citing rising inflation and Russia-Ukraine war's impact.

360.title: Pics of PM Modi's gifts to US President and PMs of Japan & Australia released
360.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted Sanjhi artwork from Uttar Pradesh's Mathura to US President Joe Biden during their meeting at the Quad Summit in Japan on Tuesday. He gifted a Gond Tribal Art painting from Madhya Pradesh to newly-elected Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, meanwhile, was gifted a wooden hand-carved box with a Gujarati Rogan painting.

361.title: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus re-elected as WHO chief for second term
361.article_body: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus was re-elected as the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) for a second five-year term on Tuesday by UN health agency's member countries. Notably, no other candidate had challenged Tedros for the post. "I'm deeply grateful for...trust and confidence of Member States. I thank all health workers and my WHO colleagues around the world," Tedros tweeted.

362.title: Was in critical condition, had to fight for life: Payal on depression
362.article_body: Actress Payal Ghosh, speaking about her battle with depression, has said, "I was in a very critical mental condition and had to fight for life." "If it hadn't been for my family and my own grit, I wouldn't have survived the years of battle," she added. Payal said depression "strikes silently" and added that she too was taken by surprise.

363.title: Will fight malicious, false accusations: Karti Chidambaram on CBI raids
363.article_body: Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram on Tuesday criticised the Centre for using its agencies to accuse him of a "malicious and completely fabricated charge". This comes after CBI raided properties owned by him and his father P Chidambaram in an ongoing visa corruption case. "Heading back home. Will fight the malicious, patently false accusations. The truth shall prevail," Karti tweeted.

364.title: PM Modi creating vision of India that excludes masses: Rahul
364.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "PM Narendra Modi is constructing a vision of India where he is leaving out huge chunks of our population." "I have a problem with it because it is completely unfair [and] because that is not what India is," Rahul said. "You have to include every single person with compassion," he added.

365.title: Old picture of Jupiter goes viral, IFS officer compares it to 'plain dosa'
365.article_body: An old image of Jupiter captured by NASA's Cassini spacecraft from the bottom is going viral on social media after being posted on Twitter by an account called Latest In Space. Several Twitter users pointed out that the image looked like that of a dosa. "Isn't it a plain dosa!!" IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted while commenting on the photo.

366.title: Yes, I have: Kartik Aaryan on if he has dated a Bollywood actress
366.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, during an interview, was asked if he has dated a Bollywood actress. To this, the actor replied, "Haan, kiya hai (Yes, I have)." This comes after Kartik, in another interview, was asked if his link-up reports with Sara Ali Khan were a promotional stunt for 'Love Aaj Kal 2', to which he had replied, "Not everything is promotional."

367.title: Dismissed Punjab Minister Singla sent to police remand till May 27
367.article_body: A Mohali court has sent former Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla to police remand till May 27 over corruption allegations against him. He was dismissed from the state cabinet on Tuesday and later arrested by the Anti-Corruption Branch. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, CM Bhagwant Mann's office said.

368.title: 26 kids report tomato flu in Odisha; Bhubaneswar has highest cases
368.article_body: As many as 26 children have been diagnosed with tomato flu in Odisha, a health official said. Of these cases, 19 are reported from Bhubaneswar, three from Puri and two each from Cuttack and Puri. It is caused by intestinal viruses and its symptoms include fever, painful sores in the mouth and rash with blisters on hands, feet and buttocks.

369.title: Rajiv not with us to see appreciation for Toolsidas Junior: Ashutosh
369.article_body: Filmmaker Ashutosh Gowariker has called it unfortunate that late veteran actor Rajiv Kapoor is not with us to see the appreciation he is getting for his performance in his last film 'Toolsidas Junior'. Ashutosh added that they had already shown him the film before he passed away. 'Toolsidas Junior' marked Rajiv's comeback to films after 30 years.

370.title: World no. 2 Medvedev wins 1st round, Shapovalov loses at French Open
370.article_body: World number two Daniil Medvedev defeated Argentina's Facundo Bagnis 6-2, 6-2, 6-2 in first round at French Open on Tuesday. It was Medvedev's first win since undergoing hernia surgery almost two months ago. He had lost his opening-round match at Geneva Open last week on his return. Meanwhile, 19-year-old Holger Rune of Denmark beat 14th-seeded Denis Shapovalov 6-3, 6-1, 7-6(7-4).

371.title: Houses of Andhra Minister, MLA set on fire amid violence over renaming district
371.article_body: Protesters have set houses of Andhra Pradesh Transport Minister Pinipe Viswarup and MLA Ponnada Satish on fire as violence broke out in Amalapuram over the renaming of newly created Konaseema district as BR Ambedkar Konaseema district, local media reports stated. A police vehicle and an educational institution's bus were also torched. Several policemen were reportedly injured in the violence.

372.title: Amit Shah to attend special screening of 'Prithviraj': Report
372.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will be attending a special preview screening of Akshay Kumar-starrer Prithviraj in Delhi in June, reported Hindustan Times. As per the report, the audience of the screening will include Cabinet Ministers, senior politicians and high-ranking bureaucrats. The film is directed by Padma Shri recipient Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi and marks the debut of Manushi Chhillar.

373.title: All 3 teams above RCB will be wary of them in playoffs: Irfan
373.article_body: Speaking about RCB, who were the last team to qualify for playoffs in IPL 2022, Irfan Pathan stated that all three teams, GT, RR and LSG, above RCB are wary of Faf du Plessis-led side now. "They (RCB) are coming on the back of an emphatic win in their previous game," he added. They'll face LSG in Eliminator on Wednesday.

374.title: J&K LG meets Kashmiri Pandits protesting over Rahul Bhat's killing
374.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Monday met Kashmiri Pandits protesting over the killing of government employee Rahul Bhat, who was killed by terrorists on May 12. One of the primary demands of the protesters is posting of Kashmiri Pandits working for J&K administration outside Kashmir. "Instructions have been issued to move you to safer locations," Sinha told the protesters.

375.title: 11 killed in late-night shootings in 2 bars in Mexico, handwritten signs left
375.article_body: Eleven people were killed in simultaneous shooting attacks on two bars in north-central Mexico, authorities said on Tuesday. Handwritten signs left at the scenes of the killings suggested the attacks were part of a rivalry between two drug cartels that have been battling for control of Guanajuato state for several years. Eight of the victims were women.

376.title: Raj CM approves proposal to eliminate job interviews for most services
376.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has approved the elimination of job interviews from the recruitment process for most services. Interviews will continue for posts under Rajasthan State and Subordinate Services (Direct Recruitment by Combined Competitive Examination) Rules, 1999, among some other posts. According to a statement, amendment in the rules will bring transparency in the recruitment process.

377.title: Nepotism hasn't worked in my favour, talent rules in this age: Adhyayan
377.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, who is the son of actor Shekhar Suman, said, "Nepotism hasn't ever worked in my favour." He further stated that debate over nepotism in Bollywood has "always been futile". "Today, Kartik Aaryan receives as much love for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' as Alia Bhatt receives for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Talent and content rule supreme in this age," he added.

378.title: Colombia soldiers to train Ukrainian military on landmine removal
378.article_body: Colombia's Defence Minister Diego Molano Aponte on Monday said that a team of Colombian soldiers will travel to Europe to train Ukraine's military on techniques to remove landmines. The experts from Colombia, which is a NATO partner, were invited to give the training by the US, he added. Colombia is one of the world's most-mined countries, according to the UN.

379.title: Assam CM visits flood-hit district Dima Hasao, reviews situation
379.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma visited state's flood and landslide-hit Dima Hasao district and reviewed the situation there on Tuesday. Sarma visited relief camps set up at schools in district's Haflong, where 80 houses were destroyed due to torrential rains earlier this month. At least 24 people died and over 7 lakh others were affected due to floods in Assam.

380.title: Mahindra honoured at US college where his father was the 1st Indian graduate
380.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra was honoured with the Dean's Medal at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, 75 years after his father Harish Mahindra became the first-ever Indian graduate of the college. Sharing pictures from the ceremony, Mahindra said, "In the 75th year of Indian Independence, I was honoured to be the first Indian to address the School's Class Day."

381.title: Rubbish, it's 10-yr-old story: Sumona on rumoured wedding with Samrat
381.article_body: Actress Sumona Chakravarti, reacting to rumours of her wedding with Bengali actor Samrat Mukerji, called them "rubbish", adding that these are "10-year-old stories from social media". The actress further said that she will make an announcement if there is any such development in her life. "Frankly, no comments, I don't like to talk about my personal life," Sumona added.

382.title: J&K govt removes Sheikh Abdullah's photograph from police medals
382.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) government has decided to remove the photograph of National Conference (NC) founder and ex-CM of the erstwhile state of J&K Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah from the J&K Police Medals for both gallantry and meritorious service. The J&K state emblem has also been removed from the medals. Abdullah's photograph will be replaced with the Indian government's National Emblem.

383.title: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa shares picture getting MRI scan
383.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, who portrays 'Aquaman', shared a picture of himself getting an MRI scan. He wrote, "You got to break some eggs to make an omelette." The actor is doing "okay" and got the MRI as "a precaution", reported People. Jason earlier had surgery to remove a hernia one day before appearing on the 94th Academy Awards red carpet.

384.title: Saudi Arabia reports limited progress in talks with Iran
384.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud on Tuesday said that there had been limited progress in talks with Iran. The Saudi minister also said that Saudi Arabia's hands remain outstretched to Iran. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two regional rivals.

385.title: People in B'wood thought I was too skinny & said 'make her fat': Madhuri
385.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that people in Bollywood thought that she was "too skinny" when she joined the industry. "During my time...they thought I was too skinny, to begin with. 'Yeh heroine, isko thoda mota karo (make this heroine a little fat)', they used to say," Madhuri stated. "I don't think that that's an issue now," she further added.

386.title: 'Manchester United are rubbish' appears on screen during broadcast, BBC blames trainee
386.article_body: The BBC has apologised after a message appeared during a broadcast on its news channel saying 'Manchester United are rubbish'. The channel blamed a trainee for the gaffe, with a presenter saying that the mistake had occurred as someone was learning how to operate the ticker and was "writing random things not in earnest".

387.title: India has immense talent, but one has to look hard to find it: Ganesh
387.article_body: Choreographer-actor Ganesh Acharya has said that there is "immense talent" in India. "But one has to look hard enough to find these hidden gems," he added. "I have also struggled in my younger years and was given an opportunity that has made me the Ganesh Acharya that I'm today," he further said. Ganesh will next be seen in 'Dehati Disco'.

388.title: World lost 11.2 crore jobs in first quarter of 2022: ILO report
388.article_body: The number of hours worked globally in the first quarter of 2022 dropped to 3.8% below the employment situation before the pandemic, a report by International Labour Organisation (ILO) revealed. The report said this is equivalent to a deficit of 11.2 crore full-time jobs. It cited fresh lockdowns in China, Ukraine-Russia conflict and inflation as the reasons for the findings.

389.title: Pics of Chinese & Russian jets near Japan during PM Modi's Quad meet released
389.article_body: Japanese Defense Ministry on Tuesday released the pictures of Chinese and Russian fighter jets that flew near Japanese airspace during the Quad meet, which was also attended by PM Narendra Modi. Japan conveyed "grave concerns" to Russia and China through diplomatic channels. A Russian TU-95 bomber, Chinese H-6 bombers and Russian IL-20 information gathering warplane were reportedly among the jets.

390.title: The richer someone is, the fewer kids they have, I'm an exception: Musk
390.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Contrary to what many think, the richer someone is, the fewer kids they have." The 50-year-old father of seven children said he's "a rare exception", adding that "most people I know have zero or one kid". Musk earlier said that the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense".

391.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammed module in Awantipora, arrest 8
391.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces busted a terror module of proscribed terrorist outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) in Awantipora by arresting eight terrorist associates. Police have also recovered incriminating materials, including ammunition, from their possession. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

392.title: Pakistani govt bans ex-PM Imran Khan's protest march to Islamabad
392.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah on Tuesday announced a ban on a planned protest march by ex-PM Imran Khan and his supporters to the country's capital Islamabad. The ban was announced after a policeman was killed during a crackdown on Khan's supporters across the country. "No one would be allowed to siege the capital and dictate his demands," Sanaullah said.

393.title: 3 Delhi tourists including 2 siblings drown in Ganga in Rishikesh
393.article_body: Three tourists from Delhi, including a brother-sister duo, drowned in Ganga river in Shivpuri on Uttarakhand's Rishikesh-Devprayag stretch on Tuesday. According to State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) officials, the deceased were part of a nine-member group of tourists. The incident took place when the three persons went to bathe in the river, where water level had increased due to rainfall.

394.title: GT skipper Hardik hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in IPL 2022: Kaif
394.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Mohammad Kaif said GT captain hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in ongoing IPL, adding he hasn't bowled in every match. "Hardik not bowling regularly is a cause for concern because when he's selected for India, it's as an all-rounder," he added. Hardik was named in India's T20I squad for upcoming five-match series against South Africa.

395.title: AAP's CM face in Goa polls Amit Palekar to head state committee
395.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday announced that its chief ministerial candidate in the recently-held Goa Assembly polls, Amit Palekar, will head the party's new committee in the state. Additionally, AAP MLAs Capt Venzy Viegas and Cruz Silva will serve as the working presidents of the executive committee. AAP won two seats in the Goa elections.

396.title: Video shows Tesla car on fire in Canada, driver says 'had to break window to escape'
396.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla Model Y on fire in Vancouver, Canada. According to the car's owner Jamil Jutha, the car lost power and shut down after warning of an "error". Jutha claimed the car started filling up with toxic smoke coming through vents, prompting him to break the window to escape as the doors wouldn't open.

397.title: My father's death was the single biggest learning experience of my life: Rahul
397.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the death of his father and the former PM of India Rajiv Gandhi was "the single biggest learning experience" of his life. His father's death caused him "tremendous pain", Rahul said, adding, "But...I can't get away from the fact that [it] also made me learn things that I would never ever have learnt otherwise."

398.title: Pic shows UK PM Boris Johnson drinking at party during lockdown in the country
398.article_body: Photographs of UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson drinking at a Downing Street gathering when the country was under lockdown have emerged. The photos, published by ITV News, show Johnson proposing a toast with a group of people next to a table with several bottles of alcohol and party food. They were taken at an event in November 2020, ITV said.

399.title: UP man arrested for sending obscene pictures to female Mumbai doctor
399.article_body: A 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly sending obscene pictures to a female doctor employed at a hospital in Mumbai's Bandra, police said on Tuesday. Police are on the lookout for the accused's accomplice, who is a former ward boy of the hospital. Police found the accused was using his younger brother's phone for the crime.

400.title: Sports and cinema have the power to unite India: Ayushmann Khurrana
400.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that sports and cinema have the power to unite India. "I have closely seen how sports brings people together in celebration and I have also witnessed how cinema can be the unifier of audiences," he said. "They transcend identities and evoke the feeling of being one in that moment," he added.
